44009004	He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him , “ Saul , Saul ! Why do you persecute me ? ”
44009005	“ Who are you , Lord ? ” he asked . “ I am Jesus , whom you persecute , ” the voice said .
44009006	“ But get up and go into the city , where you will be told what you must do . ”
44009007	The men who were traveling with Saul had stopped , not saying a word ; they heard the voice but could not see anyone .
44009008	Saul got up from the ground and opened his eyes , but could not see a thing . So they took him by the hand and led him into Damascus .
44009009	For three days he was not able to see , and during that time he did not eat or drink anything .
44009010	There was a believer in Damascus named Ananias . He had a vision , in which the Lord said to him , “ Ananias ! ” “ Here I am , Lord , ” he answered .
44009011	The Lord said to him , “ Get ready and go to Straight Street , and at the house of Judas ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul . He is praying ,
44009012	and in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come in and place his hands on him so that he might see again . ”
44009013	Ananias answered , “ Lord , many people have told me about this man and about all the terrible things he has done to your people in Jerusalem .
44009014	And he has come to Damascus with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who worship you . ”
44009015	The Lord said to him , “ Go , because I have chosen him to serve me , to make my name known to Gentiles and kings and to the people of Israel .
44009016	And I myself will show him all that he must suffer for my sake . ”
44009017	So Ananias went , entered the house where Saul was , and placed his hands on him . “ Brother Saul , ” he said , “ the Lord has sent me—Jesus himself , who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here . He sent me so that you might see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit . ”
44009018	At once something like fish scales fell from Saul's eyes , and he was able to see again . He stood up and was baptized ;
44009019	and after he had eaten , his strength came back . Saul stayed for a few days with the believers in Damascus .
44009020	He went straight to the synagogues and began to preach that Jesus was the Son of God .
44009021	All who heard him were amazed and asked , “ Isn't he the one who in Jerusalem was killing those who worship that man Jesus ? And didn't he come here for the very purpose of arresting those people and taking them back to the chief priests ? ”
44009022	But Saul's preaching became even more powerful , and his proofs that Jesus was the Messiah were so convincing that the Jews who lived in Damascus could not answer him .
44009023	After many days had gone by , the Jews met together and made plans to kill Saul ,
44009024	but he was told of their plan . Day and night they watched the city gates in order to kill him .
44009025	But one night Saul's followers took him and let him down through an opening in the wall , lowering him in a basket .
44009026	Saul went to Jerusalem and tried to join the disciples . But they would not believe that he was a disciple , and they were all afraid of him .
44009027	Then Barnabas came to his help and took him to the apostles . He explained to them how Saul had seen the Lord on the road and that the Lord had spoken to him . He also told them how boldly Saul had preached in the name of Jesus in Damascus .
44009028	And so Saul stayed with them and went all over Jerusalem , preaching boldly in the name of the Lord .
44009029	He also talked and disputed with the Greek-speaking Jews , but they tried to kill him .
44009030	When the believers found out about this , they took Saul to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus .
44009031	And so it was that the church throughout Judea , Galilee , and Samaria had a time of peace . Through the help of the Holy Spirit it was strengthened and grew in numbers , as it lived in reverence for the Lord .
44009032	Peter traveled everywhere , and on one occasion he went to visit God's people who lived in Lydda .
44009033	There he met a man named Aeneas , who was paralyzed and had not been able to get out of bed for eight years .
44009034	“ Aeneas , ” Peter said to him , “ Jesus Christ makes you well . Get up and make your bed . ” At once Aeneas got up .
44009035	All the people living in Lydda and Sharon saw him , and they turned to the Lord .
44009036	In Joppa there was a woman named Tabitha , who was a believer . ( Her name in Greek is Dorcas , meaning “ a deer . ” ) She spent all her time doing good and helping the poor .
44009037	At that time she got sick and died . Her body was washed and laid in a room upstairs .
44009038	Joppa was not very far from Lydda , and when the believers in Joppa heard that Peter was in Lydda , they sent two men to him with the message , “ Please hurry and come to us . ”
44009039	So Peter got ready and went with them . When he arrived , he was taken to the room upstairs , where all the widows crowded around him , crying and showing him all the shirts and coats that Dorcas had made while she was alive .
44009040	Peter put them all out of the room , and knelt down and prayed ; then he turned to the body and said , “ Tabitha , get up ! ” She opened her eyes , and when she saw Peter , she sat up .
44009041	Peter reached over and helped her get up . Then he called all the believers , including the widows , and presented her alive to them .
44009042	The news about this spread all over Joppa , and many people believed in the Lord .
44009043	Peter stayed on in Joppa for many days with a tanner of leather named Simon .
44010001	There was a man in Caesarea named Cornelius , who was a captain in the Roman army regiment called “ The Italian Regiment . ”
44010002	He was a religious man ; he and his whole family worshiped God . He also did much to help the Jewish poor people and was constantly praying to God .
44010003	It was about three o'clock one afternoon when he had a vision , in which he clearly saw an angel of God come in and say to him , “ Cornelius ! ”
44010004	He stared at the angel in fear and said , “ What is it , sir ? ” The angel answered , “ God is pleased with your prayers and works of charity , and is ready to answer you .
44010005	And now send some men to Joppa for a certain man whose full name is Simon Peter .
44010006	He is a guest in the home of a tanner of leather named Simon , who lives by the sea . ”
44010007	Then the angel went away , and Cornelius called two of his house servants and a soldier , a religious man who was one of his personal attendants .
44010008	He told them what had happened and sent them off to Joppa .
44010009	The next day , as they were on their way and coming near Joppa , Peter went up on the roof of the house about noon in order to pray .
44010010	He became hungry and wanted something to eat ; while the food was being prepared , he had a vision .
44010011	He saw heaven opened and something coming down that looked like a large sheet being lowered by its four corners to the earth .
44010012	In it were all kinds of animals , reptiles , and wild birds .
44010013	A voice said to him , “ Get up , Peter ; kill and eat ! ”
44010014	But Peter said , “ Certainly not , Lord ! I have never eaten anything ritually unclean or defiled . ”
44010015	The voice spoke to him again , “ Do not consider anything unclean that God has declared clean . ”
44010016	This happened three times , and then the thing was taken back up into heaven .
44010017	While Peter was wondering about the meaning of this vision , the men sent by Cornelius had learned where Simon's house was , and they were now standing in front of the gate .
44010018	They called out and asked , “ Is there a guest here by the name of Simon Peter ? ”
44010019	Peter was still trying to understand what the vision meant , when the Spirit said , “ Listen ! Three men are here looking for you .
44010020	So get ready and go down , and do not hesitate to go with them , for I have sent them . ”
44010021	So Peter went down and said to the men , “ I am the man you are looking for . Why have you come ? ”
44010022	“ Captain Cornelius sent us , ” they answered . “ He is a good man who worships God and is highly respected by all the Jewish people . An angel of God told him to invite you to his house , so that he could hear what you have to say . ”
44010023	Peter invited the men in and had them spend the night there . The next day he got ready and went with them ; and some of the believers from Joppa went along with him .
44010024	The following day he arrived in Caesarea , where Cornelius was waiting for him , together with relatives and close friends that he had invited .
44010025	As Peter was about to go in , Cornelius met him , fell at his feet , and bowed down before him .
44010026	But Peter made him rise . “ Stand up , ” he said , “ I myself am only a man . ”
44010027	Peter kept on talking to Cornelius as he went into the house , where he found many people gathered .
44010028	He said to them , “ You yourselves know very well that a Jew is not allowed by his religion to visit or associate with Gentiles . But God has shown me that I must not consider any person ritually unclean or defiled .
44010029	And so when you sent for me , I came without any objection . I ask you , then , why did you send for me ? ”
44010030	Cornelius said , “ It was about this time three days ago that I was praying in my house at three o'clock in the afternoon . Suddenly a man dressed in shining clothes stood in front of me
44010031	and said : ‘ Cornelius ! God has heard your prayer and has taken notice of your works of charity .
44010032	Send someone to Joppa for a man whose full name is Simon Peter . He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner of leather , who lives by the sea . ’
44010033	And so I sent for you at once , and you have been good enough to come . Now we are all here in the presence of God , waiting to hear anything that the Lord has instructed you to say . ”
44010034	Peter began to speak : “ I now realize that it is true that God treats everyone on the same basis .
44010035	Those who fear him and do what is right are acceptable to him , no matter what race they belong to .
44010036	You know the message he sent to the people of Israel , proclaiming the Good News of peace through Jesus Christ , who is Lord of all .
44010037	You know of the great event that took place throughout the land of Israel , beginning in Galilee after John preached his message of baptism .
44010038	You know about Jesus of Nazareth and how God poured out on him the Holy Spirit and power . He went everywhere , doing good and healing all who were under the power of the Devil , for God was with him .
44010039	We are witnesses of everything that he did in the land of Israel and in Jerusalem . Then they put him to death by nailing him to a cross .
44010040	But God raised him from death three days later and caused him to appear ,
44010041	not to everyone , but only to the witnesses that God had already chosen , that is , to us who ate and drank with him after he rose from death .
44010042	And he commanded us to preach the gospel to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God has appointed judge of the living and the dead .
44010043	All the prophets spoke about him , saying that all who believe in him will have their sins forgiven through the power of his name . ”
44010044	While Peter was still speaking , the Holy Spirit came down on all those who were listening to his message .
44010045	The Jewish believers who had come from Joppa with Peter were amazed that God had poured out his gift of the Holy Spirit on the Gentiles also .
44010046	For they heard them speaking in strange tongues and praising God's greatness . Peter spoke up :
44010047	“ These people have received the Holy Spirit , just as we also did . Can anyone , then , stop them from being baptized with water ? ”
44010048	So he ordered them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ . Then they asked him to stay with them for a few days .
44011001	The apostles and the other believers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God .
44011002	When Peter went to Jerusalem , those who were in favor of circumcising Gentiles criticized him , saying ,
44011003	“ You were a guest in the home of uncircumcised Gentiles , and you even ate with them ! ”
44011004	So Peter gave them a complete account of what had happened from the very beginning :
44011005	“ While I was praying in the city of Joppa , I had a vision . I saw something coming down that looked like a large sheet being lowered by its four corners from heaven , and it stopped next to me .
44011006	I looked closely inside and saw domesticated and wild animals , reptiles , and wild birds .
44011007	Then I heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Get up , Peter ; kill and eat ! ’
44011008	But I said , ‘ Certainly not , Lord ! No ritually unclean or defiled food has ever entered my mouth . ’
44011009	The voice spoke again from heaven , ‘ Do not consider anything unclean that God has declared clean . ’
44011010	This happened three times , and finally the whole thing was drawn back up into heaven .
44011011	At that very moment three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea arrived at the house where I was staying .
44011012	The Spirit told me to go with them without hesitation . These six fellow believers from Joppa accompanied me to Caesarea , and we all went into the house of Cornelius .
44011013	He told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house , who said to him , ‘ Send someone to Joppa for a man whose full name is Simon Peter .
44011014	He will speak words to you by which you and all your family will be saved . ’
44011015	And when I began to speak , the Holy Spirit came down on them just as on us at the beginning .
44011016	Then I remembered what the Lord had said : ‘ John baptized with water , but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit . ’
44011017	It is clear that God gave those Gentiles the same gift that he gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ ; who was I , then , to try to stop God ! ”
44011018	When they heard this , they stopped their criticism and praised God , saying , “ Then God has given to the Gentiles also the opportunity to repent and live ! ”
44011019	Some of the believers who were scattered by the persecution which took place when Stephen was killed went as far as Phoenicia , Cyprus , and Antioch , telling the message to Jews only .
44011020	But other believers , who were from Cyprus and Cyrene , went to Antioch and proclaimed the message to Gentiles also , telling them the Good News about the Lord Jesus .
44011021	The Lord's power was with them , and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord .
44011022	The news about this reached the church in Jerusalem , so they sent Barnabas to Antioch .
44011023	When he arrived and saw how God had blessed the people , he was glad and urged them all to be faithful and true to the Lord with all their hearts .
44011024	Barnabas was a good man , full of the Holy Spirit and faith , and many people were brought to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul .
44011026	When he found him , he took him to Antioch , and for a whole year the two met with the people of the church and taught a large group . It was at Antioch that the believers were first called Christians .
44011027	About that time some prophets went from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them , named Agabus , stood up and by the power of the Spirit predicted that a severe famine was about to come over all the earth . ( It came when Claudius was emperor . )
44011029	The disciples decided that they each would send as much as they could to help their fellow believers who lived in Judea .
44011030	They did this , then , and sent the money to the church elders by Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	About this time King Herod began to persecute some members of the church .
44012002	He had James , the brother of John , put to death by the sword .
44012003	When he saw that this pleased the Jews , he went ahead and had Peter arrested . ( This happened during the time of the Festival of Unleavened Bread . )
44012004	After his arrest Peter was put in jail , where he was handed over to be guarded by four groups of four soldiers each . Herod planned to put him on trial in public after Passover .
44012005	So Peter was kept in jail , but the people of the church were praying earnestly to God for him .
44012006	The night before Herod was going to bring him out to the people , Peter was sleeping between two guards . He was tied with two chains , and there were guards on duty at the prison gate .
44012007	Suddenly an angel of the Lord stood there , and a light shone in the cell . The angel shook Peter by the shoulder , woke him up , and said , “ Hurry ! Get up ! ” At once the chains fell off Peter's hands .
44012008	Then the angel said , “ Tighten your belt and put on your sandals . ” Peter did so , and the angel said , “ Put your cloak around you and come with me . ”
44012009	Peter followed him out of the prison , not knowing , however , if what the angel was doing was real ; he thought he was seeing a vision .
44012010	They passed by the first guard station and then the second , and came at last to the iron gate that opens into the city . The gate opened for them by itself , and they went out . They walked down a street , and suddenly the angel left Peter .
44012011	Then Peter realized what had happened to him , and said , “ Now I know that it is really true ! The Lord sent his angel to rescue me from Herod's power and from everything the Jewish people expected to happen . ”
44012012	Aware of his situation , he went to the home of Mary , the mother of John Mark , where many people had gathered and were praying .
44012013	Peter knocked at the outside door , and a servant named Rhoda came to answer it .
44012014	She recognized Peter's voice and was so happy that she ran back in without opening the door , and announced that Peter was standing outside .
44012015	“ You are crazy ! ” they told her . But she insisted that it was true . So they answered , “ It is his angel . ”
44012016	Meanwhile Peter kept on knocking . At last they opened the door , and when they saw him , they were amazed .
44012017	He motioned with his hand for them to be quiet , and he explained to them how the Lord had brought him out of prison . “ Tell this to James and the rest of the believers , ” he said ; then he left and went somewhere else .
44012018	When morning came , there was a tremendous confusion among the guards—what had happened to Peter ?
44012019	Herod gave orders to search for him , but they could not find him . So he had the guards questioned and ordered them put to death . After this , Herod left Judea and spent some time in Caesarea .
44012020	Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon , so they went in a group to see him . First they convinced Blastus , the man in charge of the palace , that he should help them . Then they went to Herod and asked him for peace , because their country got its food supplies from the king's country .
44012021	On a chosen day Herod put on his royal robes , sat on his throne , and made a speech to the people .
44012022	“ It isn't a man speaking , but a god ! ” they shouted .
44012023	At once the angel of the Lord struck Herod down , because he did not give honor to God . He was eaten by worms and died .
44012024	Meanwhile the word of God continued to spread and grow .
44012025	Barnabas and Saul finished their mission and returned from Jerusalem , taking John Mark with them .
44013001	In the church at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers : Barnabas , Simeon ( called the Black ) , Lucius ( from Cyrene ) , Manaen ( who had been brought up with Governor Herod ) , and Saul .
44013002	While they were serving the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said to them , “ Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul , to do the work to which I have called them . ”
44013003	They fasted and prayed , placed their hands on them , and sent them off .
44013004	Having been sent by the Holy Spirit , Barnabas and Saul went to Seleucia and sailed from there to the island of Cyprus .
44013005	When they arrived at Salamis , they preached the word of God in the synagogues . They had John Mark with them to help in the work .
44013006	They went all the way across the island to Paphos , where they met a certain magician named Bar-Jesus , a Jew who claimed to be a prophet .
44013007	He was a friend of the governor of the island , Sergius Paulus , who was an intelligent man . The governor called Barnabas and Saul before him because he wanted to hear the word of God .
44013008	But they were opposed by the magician Elymas ( that is his name in Greek ) , who tried to turn the governor away from the faith .
44013009	Then Saul—also known as Paul—was filled with the Holy Spirit ; he looked straight at the magician
44013010	and said , “ You son of the Devil ! You are the enemy of everything that is good . You are full of all kinds of evil tricks , and you always keep trying to turn the Lord's truths into lies !
44013011	The Lord's hand will come down on you now ; you will be blind and will not see the light of day for a time . ” At once Elymas felt a dark mist cover his eyes , and he walked around trying to find someone to lead him by the hand .
44013012	When the governor saw what had happened , he believed ; for he was greatly amazed at the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	Paul and his companions sailed from Paphos and came to Perga , a city in Pamphylia , where John Mark left them and went back to Jerusalem .
44013014	They went on from Perga and arrived in Antioch in Pisidia , and on the Sabbath they went into the synagogue and sat down .
44013015	After the reading from the Law of Moses and from the writings of the prophets , the officials of the synagogue sent them a message : “ Friends , we want you to speak to the people if you have a message of encouragement for them . ”
44013016	Paul stood up , motioned with his hand , and began to speak : “ Fellow Israelites and all Gentiles here who worship God : hear me !
44013017	The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors and made the people a great nation during the time they lived as foreigners in Egypt . God brought them out of Egypt by his great power ,
44013018	and for forty years he endured them in the desert .
44013019	He destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan and made his people the owners of the land .
44013020	All of this took about 450 years . “ After this he gave them judges until the time of the prophet Samuel .
44013021	And when they asked for a king , God gave them Saul son of Kish from the tribe of Benjamin , to be their king for forty years .
44013022	After removing him , God made David their king . This is what God said about him : ‘ I have found that David son of Jesse is the kind of man I like , a man who will do all I want him to do . ’
44013023	It was Jesus , a descendant of David , whom God made the Savior of the people of Israel , as he had promised .
44013024	Before Jesus began his work , John preached to all the people of Israel that they should turn from their sins and be baptized .
44013025	And as John was about to finish his mission , he said to the people , ‘ Who do you think I am ? I am not the one you are waiting for . But listen ! He is coming after me , and I am not good enough to take his sandals off his feet . ’
44013026	“ My fellow Israelites , descendants of Abraham , and all Gentiles here who worship God : it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent !
44013027	For the people who live in Jerusalem and their leaders did not know that he is the Savior , nor did they understand the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath . Yet they made the prophets' words come true by condemning Jesus .
44013028	And even though they could find no reason to pass the death sentence on him , they asked Pilate to have him put to death .
44013029	And after they had done everything that the Scriptures say about him , they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised him from death ,
44013031	and for many days he appeared to those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem . They are now witnesses for him to the people of Israel .
44013041	‘ Look , you scoffers ! Be astonished and die ! For what I am doing today is something that you will not believe , even when someone explains it to you ! ’ ”
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue , the people invited them to come back the next Sabbath and tell them more about these things .
44013043	After the people had left the meeting , Paul and Barnabas were followed by many Jews and by many Gentiles who had been converted to Judaism . The apostles spoke to them and encouraged them to keep on living in the grace of God .
44013044	The next Sabbath nearly everyone in the town came to hear the word of the Lord .
44013045	When the Jews saw the crowds , they were filled with jealousy ; they disputed what Paul was saying and insulted him .
44013046	But Paul and Barnabas spoke out even more boldly : “ It was necessary that the word of God should be spoken first to you . But since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life , we will leave you and go to the Gentiles .
44013047	For this is the commandment that the Lord has given us : ‘ I have made you a light for the Gentiles , so that all the world may be saved . ’ ”
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they were glad and praised the Lord's message ; and those who had been chosen for eternal life became believers .
44013049	The word of the Lord spread everywhere in that region .
44013050	But the Jews stirred up the leading men of the city and the Gentile women of high social standing who worshiped God . They started a persecution against Paul and Barnabas and threw them out of their region .
44013051	The apostles shook the dust off their feet in protest against them and went on to Iconium .
44013052	The believers in Antioch were full of joy and the Holy Spirit .
44014001	The same thing happened in Iconium : Paul and Barnabas went to the synagogue and spoke in such a way that a great number of Jews and Gentiles became believers .
44014002	But the Jews who would not believe stirred up the Gentiles and turned them against the believers .
44014003	The apostles stayed there for a long time , speaking boldly about the Lord , who proved that their message about his grace was true by giving them the power to perform miracles and wonders .
44014004	The people of the city were divided : some were for the Jews , others for the apostles .
44014005	Then some Gentiles and Jews , together with their leaders , decided to mistreat the apostles and stone them .
44014006	When the apostles learned about it , they fled to the cities of Lystra and Derbe in Lycaonia and to the surrounding territory .
44014007	There they preached the Good News .
44014008	In Lystra there was a crippled man who had been lame from birth and had never been able to walk .
44014009	He sat there and listened to Paul's words . Paul saw that he believed and could be healed , so he looked straight at him
44014010	and said in a loud voice , “ Stand up straight on your feet ! ” The man jumped up and started walking around .
44014011	When the crowds saw what Paul had done , they started shouting in their own Lycaonian language , “ The gods have become like men and have come down to us ! ”
44014012	They gave Barnabas the name Zeus , and Paul the name Hermes , because he was the chief speaker .
44014013	The priest of the god Zeus , whose temple stood just outside the town , brought bulls and flowers to the gate , for he and the crowds wanted to offer sacrifice to the apostles .
44014014	When Barnabas and Paul heard what they were about to do , they tore their clothes and ran into the middle of the crowd , shouting ,
44014015	“ Why are you doing this ? We ourselves are only human beings like you ! We are here to announce the Good News , to turn you away from these worthless things to the living God , who made heaven , earth , sea , and all that is in them .
44014016	In the past he allowed all people to go their own way .
44014017	But he has always given evidence of his existence by the good things he does : he gives you rain from heaven and crops at the right times ; he gives you food and fills your hearts with happiness . ”
44014018	Even with these words the apostles could hardly keep the crowd from offering a sacrifice to them .
44014019	Some Jews came from Antioch in Pisidia and from Iconium ; they won the crowds over to their side , stoned Paul and dragged him out of the town , thinking that he was dead .
44014020	But when the believers gathered around him , he got up and went back into the town . The next day he and Barnabas went to Derbe .
44014021	Paul and Barnabas preached the Good News in Derbe and won many disciples . Then they went back to Lystra , to Iconium , and on to Antioch in Pisidia .
44014022	They strengthened the believers and encouraged them to remain true to the faith . “ We must pass through many troubles to enter the Kingdom of God , ” they taught .
44014023	In each church they appointed elders , and with prayers and fasting they commended them to the Lord , in whom they had put their trust .
44014024	After going through the territory of Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
44014025	There they preached the message in Perga and then went to Attalia ,
44014026	and from there they sailed back to Antioch , the place where they had been commended to the care of God's grace for the work they had now completed .
44014027	When they arrived in Antioch , they gathered the people of the church together and told them about all that God had done with them and how he had opened the way for the Gentiles to believe .
44014028	And they stayed a long time there with the believers .
44015001	Some men came from Judea to Antioch and started teaching the believers , “ You cannot be saved unless you are circumcised as the Law of Moses requires . ”
44015002	Paul and Barnabas got into a fierce argument with them about this , so it was decided that Paul and Barnabas and some of the others in Antioch should go to Jerusalem and see the apostles and elders about this matter .
44015003	They were sent on their way by the church ; and as they went through Phoenicia and Samaria , they reported how the Gentiles had turned to God ; this news brought great joy to all the believers .
44015004	When they arrived in Jerusalem , they were welcomed by the church , the apostles , and the elders , to whom they told all that God had done through them .
44015005	But some of the believers who belonged to the party of the Pharisees stood up and said , “ The Gentiles must be circumcised and told to obey the Law of Moses . ”
44015006	The apostles and the elders met together to consider this question .
44015007	After a long debate Peter stood up and said , “ My friends , you know that a long time ago God chose me from among you to preach the Good News to the Gentiles , so that they could hear and believe .
44015008	And God , who knows the thoughts of everyone , showed his approval of the Gentiles by giving the Holy Spirit to them , just as he had to us .
44015009	He made no difference between us and them ; he forgave their sins because they believed .
44015010	So then , why do you now want to put God to the test by laying a load on the backs of the believers which neither our ancestors nor we ourselves were able to carry ?
44015011	No ! We believe and are saved by the grace of the Lord Jesus , just as they are . ”
44015012	The whole group was silent as they heard Barnabas and Paul report all the miracles and wonders that God had performed through them among the Gentiles .
44015013	When they had finished speaking , James spoke up : “ Listen to me , my friends !
44015014	Simon has just explained how God first showed his care for the Gentiles by taking from among them a people to belong to him .
44015015	The words of the prophets agree completely with this . As the scripture says ,
44015016	‘ After this I will return , says the Lord , and restore the kingdom of David . I will rebuild its ruins and make it strong again .
44015017	And so all the rest of the human race will come to me , all the Gentiles whom I have called to be my own .
44015018	So says the Lord , who made this known long ago . ’
44015019	“ It is my opinion , ” James went on , “ that we should not trouble the Gentiles who are turning to God .
44015020	Instead , we should write a letter telling them not to eat any food that is ritually unclean because it has been offered to idols ; to keep themselves from sexual immorality ; and not to eat any animal that has been strangled , or any blood .
44015021	For the Law of Moses has been read for a very long time in the synagogues every Sabbath , and his words are preached in every town . ”
44015022	Then the apostles and the elders , together with the whole church , decided to choose some men from the group and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas . They chose two men who were highly respected by the believers , Judas , called Barsabbas , and Silas ,
44015023	and they sent the following letter by them :
44015030	The messengers were sent off and went to Antioch , where they gathered the whole group of believers and gave them the letter .
44015031	When the people read it , they were filled with joy by the message of encouragement .
44015032	Judas and Silas , who were themselves prophets , spoke a long time with them , giving them courage and strength .
44015033	After spending some time there , they were sent off in peace by the believers and went back to those who had sent them .
44015035	Paul and Barnabas spent some time in Antioch , and together with many others they taught and preached the word of the Lord .
44015036	Some time later Paul said to Barnabas , “ Let us go back and visit the believers in every town where we preached the word of the Lord , and let us find out how they are getting along . ”
44015037	Barnabas wanted to take John Mark with them ,
44015038	but Paul did not think it was right to take him , because he had not stayed with them to the end of their mission , but had turned back and left them in Pamphylia .
44015039	There was a sharp argument , and they separated : Barnabas took Mark and sailed off for Cyprus ,
44015040	while Paul chose Silas and left , commended by the believers to the care of the Lord's grace .
44015041	He went through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the churches .
44016001	Paul traveled on to Derbe and Lystra , where a Christian named Timothy lived . His mother , who was also a Christian , was Jewish , but his father was a Greek .
44016002	All the believers in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of Timothy .
44016003	Paul wanted to take Timothy along with him , so he circumcised him . He did so because all the Jews who lived in those places knew that Timothy's father was Greek .
44016004	As they went through the towns , they delivered to the believers the rules decided upon by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem , and they told them to obey those rules .
44016005	So the churches were made stronger in the faith and grew in numbers every day .
44016006	They traveled through the region of Phrygia and Galatia because the Holy Spirit did not let them preach the message in the province of Asia .
44016007	When they reached the border of Mysia , they tried to go into the province of Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them .
44016008	So they traveled right on through Mysia and went to Troas .
44016009	That night Paul had a vision in which he saw a Macedonian standing and begging him , “ Come over to Macedonia and help us ! ”
44016010	As soon as Paul had this vision , we got ready to leave for Macedonia , because we decided that God had called us to preach the Good News to the people there .
44016011	We left by ship from Troas and sailed straight across to Samothrace , and the next day to Neapolis .
44016012	From there we went inland to Philippi , a city of the first district of Macedonia ; it is also a Roman colony . We spent several days there .
44016013	On the Sabbath we went out of the city to the riverside , where we thought there would be a place where Jews gathered for prayer . We sat down and talked to the women who gathered there .
44016014	One of those who heard us was Lydia from Thyatira , who was a dealer in purple cloth . She was a woman who worshiped God , and the Lord opened her mind to pay attention to what Paul was saying .
44016015	After she and the people of her house had been baptized , she invited us , “ Come and stay in my house if you have decided that I am a true believer in the Lord . ” And she persuaded us to go .
44016016	One day as we were going to the place of prayer , we were met by a young servant woman who had an evil spirit that enabled her to predict the future . She earned a lot of money for her owners by telling fortunes .
44016017	She followed Paul and us , shouting , “ These men are servants of the Most High God ! They announce to you how you can be saved ! ”
44016018	She did this for many days , until Paul became so upset that he turned around and said to the spirit , “ In the name of Jesus Christ I order you to come out of her ! ” The spirit went out of her that very moment .
44016019	When her owners realized that their chance of making money was gone , they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them to the authorities in the public square .
44016020	They brought them before the Roman officials and said , “ These men are Jews , and they are causing trouble in our city .
44016021	They are teaching customs that are against our law ; we are Roman citizens , and we cannot accept these customs or practice them . ”
44016022	And the crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas . Then the officials tore the clothes off Paul and Silas and ordered them to be whipped .
44016023	After a severe beating , they were thrown into jail , and the jailer was ordered to lock them up tight .
44016024	Upon receiving this order , the jailer threw them into the inner cell and fastened their feet between heavy blocks of wood .
44016025	About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the other prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly there was a violent earthquake , which shook the prison to its foundations . At once all the doors opened , and the chains fell off all the prisoners .
44016027	The jailer woke up , and when he saw the prison doors open , he thought that the prisoners had escaped ; so he pulled out his sword and was about to kill himself .
44016028	But Paul shouted at the top of his voice , “ Don't harm yourself We are all here ! ”
44016029	The jailer called for a light , rushed in , and fell trembling at the feet of Paul and Silas .
44016030	Then he led them out and asked , “ Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They answered , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus , and you will be saved—you and your family . ”
44016032	Then they preached the word of the Lord to him and to all the others in the house .
44016033	At that very hour of the night the jailer took them and washed their wounds ; and he and all his family were baptized at once .
44016034	Then he took Paul and Silas up into his house and gave them some food to eat . He and his family were filled with joy , because they now believed in God .
44016035	The next morning the Roman authorities sent police officers with the order , “ Let those men go . ”
44016036	So the jailer told Paul , “ The officials have sent an order for you and Silas to be released . You may leave , then , and go in peace . ”
44016037	But Paul said to the police officers , “ We were not found guilty of any crime , yet they whipped us in public—and we are Roman citizens ! Then they threw us in prison . And now they want to send us away secretly ? Not at all ! The Roman officials themselves must come here and let us out . ”
44016038	The police officers reported these words to the Roman officials ; and when they heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens , they were afraid .
44016039	So they went and apologized to them ; then they led them out of the prison and asked them to leave the city .
44016040	Paul and Silas left the prison and went to Lydia's house . There they met the believers , spoke words of encouragement to them , and left .
44017001	Paul and Silas traveled on through Amphipolis and Apollonia and came to Thessalonica , where there was a synagogue .
44017002	According to his usual habit Paul went to the synagogue . There during three Sabbaths he held discussions with the people , quoting
44017003	and explaining the Scriptures , and proving from them that the Messiah had to suffer and rise from death . “ This Jesus whom I announce to you , ” Paul said , “ is the Messiah . ”
44017004	Some of them were convinced and joined Paul and Silas ; so did many of the leading women and a large group of Greeks who worshiped God .
44017005	But some Jews were jealous and gathered worthless loafers from the streets and formed a mob . They set the whole city in an uproar and attacked the home of a man named Jason , in an attempt to find Paul and Silas and bring them out to the people .
44017006	But when they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some other believers before the city authorities and shouted , “ These men have caused trouble everywhere ! Now they have come to our city ,
44017007	and Jason has kept them in his house . They are all breaking the laws of the Emperor , saying that there is another king , whose name is Jesus . ”
44017008	With these words they threw the crowd and the city authorities in an uproar .
44017009	The authorities made Jason and the others pay the required amount of money to be released , and then let them go .
44017010	As soon as night came , the believers sent Paul and Silas to Berea . When they arrived , they went to the synagogue .
44017011	The people there were more open-minded than the people in Thessalonica . They listened to the message with great eagerness , and every day they studied the Scriptures to see if what Paul said was really true .
44017012	Many of them believed ; and many Greek women of high social standing and many Greek men also believed .
44017013	But when the Jews in Thessalonica heard that Paul had preached the word of God in Berea also , they came there and started exciting and stirring up the mobs .
44017014	At once the believers sent Paul away to the coast ; but both Silas and Timothy stayed in Berea .
44017015	The men who were taking Paul went with him as far as Athens and then returned to Berea with instructions from Paul that Silas and Timothy should join him as soon as possible .
44017016	While Paul was waiting in Athens for Silas and Timothy , he was greatly upset when he noticed how full of idols the city was .
44017017	So he held discussions in the synagogue with the Jews and with the Gentiles who worshiped God , and also in the public square every day with the people who happened to come by .
44017018	Certain Epicurean and Stoic teachers also debated with him . Some of them asked , “ What is this ignorant show-off trying to say ? ” Others answered , “ He seems to be talking about foreign gods . ” They said this because Paul was preaching about Jesus and the resurrection .
44017019	So they took Paul , brought him before the city council , the Areopagus , and said , “ We would like to know what this new teaching is that you are talking about .
44017020	Some of the things we hear you say sound strange to us , and we would like to know what they mean . ” (
44017021	For all the citizens of Athens and the foreigners who lived there liked to spend all their time telling and hearing the latest new thing . )
44017022	Paul stood up in front of the city council and said , “ I see that in every way you Athenians are very religious .
44017023	For as I walked through your city and looked at the places where you worship , I found an altar on which is written , ‘ To an Unknown God . ’ That which you worship , then , even though you do not know it , is what I now proclaim to you .
44017024	God , who made the world and everything in it , is Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples made by human hands .
44017025	Nor does he need anything that we can supply by working for him , since it is he himself who gives life and breath and everything else to everyone .
44017026	From one human being he created all races of people and made them live throughout the whole earth . He himself fixed beforehand the exact times and the limits of the places where they would live .
44017027	He did this so that they would look for him , and perhaps find him as they felt around for him . Yet God is actually not far from any one of us ;
44017028	as someone has said , ‘ In him we live and move and exist . ’ ‘ We too are his children . ’
44017032	When they heard Paul speak about a raising from death , some of them made fun of him , but others said , “ We want to hear you speak about this again . ”
44017033	And so Paul left the meeting .
44017034	Some men joined him and believed , among whom was Dionysius , a member of the council ; there was also a woman named Damaris , and some other people .
44018001	After this , Paul left Athens and went on to Corinth .
44018002	There he met a Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla , for Emperor Claudius had ordered all the Jews to leave Rome . Paul went to see them ,
44018003	and stayed and worked with them , because he earned his living by making tents , just as they did .
44018004	He held discussions in the synagogue every Sabbath , trying to convince both Jews and Greeks .
44018005	When Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia , Paul gave his whole time to preaching the message , testifying to the Jews that Jesus is the Messiah .
44018006	When they opposed him and said evil things about him , he protested by shaking the dust from his clothes and saying to them , “ If you are lost , you yourselves must take the blame for it ! I am not responsible . From now on I will go to the Gentiles . ”
44018007	So he left them and went to live in the house of a Gentile named Titius Justus , who worshiped God ; his house was next to the synagogue .
44018008	Crispus , who was the leader of the synagogue , believed in the Lord , together with all his family ; and many other people in Corinth heard the message , believed , and were baptized .
44018009	One night Paul had a vision in which the Lord said to him , “ Do not be afraid , but keep on speaking and do not give up ,
44018010	for I am with you . No one will be able to harm you , for many in this city are my people . ”
44018011	So Paul stayed there for a year and a half , teaching the people the word of God .
44018012	When Gallio was made the Roman governor of Achaia , Jews there got together , seized Paul , and took him into court .
44018013	“ This man , ” they said , “ is trying to persuade people to worship God in a way that is against the law ! ”
44018014	Paul was about to speak when Gallio said to the Jews , “ If this were a matter of some evil crime or wrong that has been committed , it would be reasonable for me to be patient with you Jews .
44018015	But since it is an argument about words and names and your own law , you yourselves must settle it . I will not be the judge of such things ! ”
44018016	And he drove them out of the court .
44018017	They all grabbed Sosthenes , the leader of the synagogue , and beat him in front of the court . But that did not bother Gallio a bit .
44018018	Paul stayed on with the believers in Corinth for many days , then left them and sailed off with Priscilla and Aquila for Syria . Before sailing from Cenchreae he had his head shaved because of a vow he had taken .
44018019	They arrived in Ephesus , where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila . He went into the synagogue and held discussions with the Jews .
44018020	The people asked him to stay longer , but he would not consent .
44018021	Instead , he told them as he left , “ If it is the will of God , I will come back to you . ” And so he sailed from Ephesus .
44018022	When he arrived at Caesarea , he went to Jerusalem and greeted the church , and then went to Antioch .
44018023	After spending some time there , he left and went through the region of Galatia and Phrygia , strengthening all the believers .
44018024	At that time a Jew named Apollos , who had been born in Alexandria , came to Ephesus . He was an eloquent speaker and had a thorough knowledge of the Scriptures .
44018025	He had been instructed in the Way of the Lord , and with great enthusiasm he proclaimed and taught correctly the facts about Jesus . However , he knew only the baptism of John .
44018026	He began to speak boldly in the synagogue . When Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they took him home with them and explained to him more correctly the Way of God .
44018027	Apollos then decided to go to Achaia , so the believers in Ephesus helped him by writing to the believers in Achaia , urging them to welcome him . When he arrived , he was a great help to those who through God's grace had become believers .
44018028	For with his strong arguments he defeated the Jews in public debates by proving from the Scriptures that Jesus is the Messiah .
44019001	While Apollos was in Corinth , Paul traveled through the interior of the province and arrived in Ephesus . There he found some disciples
44019002	and asked them , “ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you became believers ? ” “ We have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit , ” they answered .
44019003	“ Well , then , what kind of baptism did you receive ? ” Paul asked . “ The baptism of John , ” they answered .
44019004	Paul said , “ The baptism of John was for those who turned from their sins ; and he told the people of Israel to believe in the one who was coming after him—that is , in Jesus . ”
44019005	When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	Paul placed his hands on them , and the Holy Spirit came upon them ; they spoke in strange tongues and also proclaimed God's message .
44019007	They were about twelve men in all .
44019008	Paul went into the synagogue and for three months spoke boldly with the people , holding discussions with them and trying to convince them about the Kingdom of God .
44019009	But some of them were stubborn and would not believe , and before the whole group they said evil things about the Way of the Lord . So Paul left them and took the believers with him , and every day he held discussions in the lecture hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This went on for two years , so that all the people who lived in the province of Asia , both Jews and Gentiles , heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God was performing unusual miracles through Paul .
44019012	Even handkerchiefs and aprons he had used were taken to the sick , and their diseases were driven away , and the evil spirits would go out of them .
44019013	Some Jews who traveled around and drove out evil spirits also tried to use the name of the Lord Jesus to do this . They said to the evil spirits , “ I command you in the name of Jesus , whom Paul preaches . ”
44019014	Seven brothers , who were the sons of a Jewish High Priest named Sceva , were doing this .
44019015	But the evil spirit said to them , “ I know Jesus , and I know about Paul ; but you—who are you ? ”
44019016	The man who had the evil spirit in him attacked them with such violence that he overpowered them all . They ran away from his house , wounded and with their clothes torn off .
44019017	All the Jews and Gentiles who lived in Ephesus heard about this ; they were all filled with fear , and the name of the Lord Jesus was given greater honor .
44019018	Many of the believers came , publicly admitting and revealing what they had done .
44019019	Many of those who had practiced magic brought their books together and burned them in public . They added up the price of the books , and the total came to fifty thousand silver coins .
44019020	In this powerful way the word of the Lord kept spreading and growing stronger .
44019021	After these things had happened , Paul made up his mind to travel through Macedonia and Achaia and go on to Jerusalem . “ After I go there , ” he said , “ I must also see Rome . ”
44019022	So he sent Timothy and Erastus , two of his helpers , to Macedonia , while he spent more time in the province of Asia .
44019023	It was at this time that there was serious trouble in Ephesus because of the Way of the Lord .
44019024	A certain silversmith named Demetrius made silver models of the temple of the goddess Artemis , and his business brought a great deal of profit to the workers .
44019025	So he called them all together with others whose work was like theirs and said to them , “ Men , you know that our prosperity comes from this work .
44019026	Now , you can see and hear for yourselves what this fellow Paul is doing . He says that hand-made gods are not gods at all , and he has succeeded in convincing many people , both here in Ephesus and in nearly the whole province of Asia .
44019027	There is the danger , then , that this business of ours will get a bad name . Not only that , but there is also the danger that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will come to mean nothing and that her greatness will be destroyed—the goddess worshiped by everyone in Asia and in all the world ! ”
44019028	As the crowd heard these words , they became furious and started shouting , “ Great is Artemis of Ephesus ! ”
44019029	The uproar spread throughout the whole city . The mob grabbed Gaius and Aristarchus , two Macedonians who were traveling with Paul , and rushed with them to the theater .
44019030	Paul himself wanted to go before the crowd , but the believers would not let him .
44019031	Some of the provincial authorities , who were his friends , also sent him a message begging him not to show himself in the theater .
44019032	Meanwhile the whole meeting was in an uproar : some people were shouting one thing , others were shouting something else , because most of them did not even know why they had come together .
44019033	Some of the people concluded that Alexander was responsible , since the Jews made him go up to the front . Then Alexander motioned with his hand for the people to be silent , and he tried to make a speech of defense .
44019034	But when they recognized that he was a Jew , they all shouted together the same thing for two hours : “ Great is Artemis of Ephesus ! ”
44019035	At last the city clerk was able to calm the crowd . “ Fellow Ephesians ! ” he said . “ Everyone knows that the city of Ephesus is the keeper of the temple of the great Artemis and of the sacred stone that fell down from heaven .
44019036	Nobody can deny these things . So then , you must calm down and not do anything reckless .
44019037	You have brought these men here even though they have not robbed temples or said evil things about our goddess .
44019038	If Demetrius and his workers have an accusation against anyone , we have the authorities and the regular days for court ; charges can be made there .
44019039	But if there is something more that you want , it will have to be settled in a legal meeting of citizens .
44019040	For after what has happened today , there is the danger that we will be accused of a riot . There is no excuse for all this uproar , and we would not be able to give a good reason for it . ”
44019041	After saying this , he dismissed the meeting .
44020001	After the uproar died down , Paul called together the believers and with words of encouragement said good-bye to them . Then he left and went on to Macedonia .
44020002	He went through those regions and encouraged the people with many messages . Then he came to Achaia ,
44020003	where he stayed three months . He was getting ready to go to Syria when he discovered that there were Jews plotting against him ; so he decided to go back through Macedonia .
44020004	Sopater son of Pyrrhus , from Berea , went with him ; so did Aristarchus and Secundus , from Thessalonica ; Gaius , from Derbe ; Tychicus and Trophimus , from the province of Asia ; and Timothy .
44020005	They went ahead and waited for us in Troas .
44020006	We sailed from Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread , and five days later we joined them in Troas , where we spent a week .
44020007	On Saturday evening we gathered together for the fellowship meal . Paul spoke to the people and kept on speaking until midnight , since he was going to leave the next day .
44020008	Many lamps were burning in the upstairs room where we were meeting .
44020009	A young man named Eutychus was sitting in the window , and as Paul kept on talking , Eutychus got sleepier and sleepier , until he finally went sound asleep and fell from the third story to the ground . When they picked him up , he was dead .
44020010	But Paul went down and threw himself on him and hugged him . “ Don't worry , ” he said , “ he is still alive ! ”
44020011	Then he went back upstairs , broke bread , and ate . After talking with them for a long time , even until sunrise , Paul left .
44020012	They took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted .
44020013	We went on ahead to the ship and sailed off to Assos , where we were going to take Paul aboard . He had told us to do this , because he was going there by land .
44020014	When he met us in Assos , we took him aboard and went on to Mitylene .
44020015	We sailed from there and arrived off Chios the next day . A day later we came to Samos , and the following day we reached Miletus .
44020016	Paul had decided to sail on by Ephesus , so as not to lose any time in the province of Asia . He was in a hurry to arrive in Jerusalem by the day of Pentecost , if at all possible .
44020017	From Miletus Paul sent a message to Ephesus , asking the elders of the church to meet him .
44020018	When they arrived , he said to them , “ You know how I spent the whole time I was with you , from the first day I arrived in the province of Asia .
44020019	With all humility and many tears I did my work as the Lord's servant during the hard times that came to me because of the plots of some Jews .
44020020	You know that I did not hold back anything that would be of help to you as I preached and taught in public and in your homes .
44020021	To Jews and Gentiles alike I gave solemn warning that they should turn from their sins to God and believe in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	And now , in obedience to the Holy Spirit I am going to Jerusalem , not knowing what will happen to me there .
44020023	I only know that in every city the Holy Spirit has warned me that prison and troubles wait for me .
44020024	But I reckon my own life to be worth nothing to me ; I only want to complete my mission and finish the work that the Lord Jesus gave me to do , which is to declare the Good News about the grace of God .
44020025	“ I have gone about among all of you , preaching the Kingdom of God . And now I know that none of you will ever see me again .
44020026	So I solemnly declare to you this very day : if any of you should be lost , I am not responsible .
44020027	For I have not held back from announcing to you the whole purpose of God .
44020028	So keep watch over yourselves and over all the flock which the Holy Spirit has placed in your care . Be shepherds of the church of God , which he made his own through the blood of his Son .
44020029	I know that after I leave , fierce wolves will come among you , and they will not spare the flock .
44020030	The time will come when some men from your own group will tell lies to lead the believers away after them .
44020031	Watch , then , and remember that with many tears , day and night , I taught every one of you for three years .
44020032	“ And now I commend you to the care of God and to the message of his grace , which is able to build you up and give you the blessings God has for all his people .
44020033	I have not wanted anyone's silver or gold or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that I have worked with these hands of mine to provide everything that my companions and I have needed .
44020035	I have shown you in all things that by working hard in this way we must help the weak , remembering the words that the Lord Jesus himself said , ‘ There is more happiness in giving than in receiving . ’ ”
44020036	When Paul finished , he knelt down with them and prayed .
44020037	They were all crying as they hugged him and kissed him good-bye .
44020038	They were especially sad because he had said that they would never see him again . And so they went with him to the ship .
44021001	We said good-bye to them and left . After sailing straight across , we came to Cos ; the next day we reached Rhodes , and from there we went on to Patara .
44021002	There we found a ship that was going to Phoenicia , so we went aboard and sailed away .
44021003	We came to where we could see Cyprus , and then sailed south of it on to Syria . We went ashore at Tyre , where the ship was going to unload its cargo .
44021004	There we found some believers and stayed with them a week . By the power of the Spirit they told Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021005	But when our time with them was over , we left and went on our way . All of them , together with their wives and children , went with us out of the city to the beach , where we all knelt and prayed .
44021006	Then we said good-bye to one another , and we went on board the ship while they went back home .
44021007	We continued our voyage , sailing from Tyre to Ptolemais , where we greeted the believers and stayed with them for a day .
44021008	On the following day we left and arrived in Caesarea . There we stayed at the house of Philip the evangelist , one of the seven men who had been chosen as helpers in Jerusalem .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who proclaimed God's message .
44021010	We had been there for several days when a prophet named Agabus arrived from Judea .
44021011	He came to us , took Paul's belt , tied up his own feet and hands with it , and said , “ This is what the Holy Spirit says : The owner of this belt will be tied up in this way by the Jews in Jerusalem , and they will hand him over to the Gentiles . ”
44021012	When we heard this , we and the others there begged Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021013	But he answered , “ What are you doing , crying like this and breaking my heart ? I am ready not only to be tied up in Jerusalem but even to die there for the sake of the Lord Jesus . ”
44021014	We could not convince him , so we gave up and said , “ May the Lord's will be done . ”
44021015	After spending some time there , we got our things ready and left for Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us and took us to the house of the man we were going to stay with —Mnason , from Cyprus , who had been a believer since the early days .
44021017	When we arrived in Jerusalem , the believers welcomed us warmly .
44021018	The next day Paul went with us to see James ; and all the church elders were present .
44021019	Paul greeted them and gave a complete report of everything that God had done among the Gentiles through his work .
44021020	After hearing him , they all praised God . Then they said , “ Brother Paul , you can see how many thousands of Jews have become believers , and how devoted they all are to the Law .
44021021	They have been told that you have been teaching all the Jews who live in Gentile countries to abandon the Law of Moses , telling them not to circumcise their children or follow the Jewish customs .
44021022	They are sure to hear that you have arrived . What should be done , then ?
44021023	This is what we want you to do . There are four men here who have taken a vow .
44021024	Go along with them and join them in the ceremony of purification and pay their expenses ; then they will be able to shave their heads . In this way everyone will know that there is no truth in any of the things that they have been told about you , but that you yourself live in accordance with the Law of Moses .
44021025	But as for the Gentiles who have become believers , we have sent them a letter telling them we decided that they must not eat any food that has been offered to idols , or any blood , or any animal that has been strangled , and that they must keep themselves from sexual immorality . ”
44021026	So Paul took the men and the next day performed the ceremony of purification with them . Then he went into the Temple and gave notice of how many days it would be until the end of the period of purification , when a sacrifice would be offered for each one of them .
44021027	But just when the seven days were about to come to an end , some Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul in the Temple . They stirred up the whole crowd and grabbed Paul .
44021028	“ People of Israel ! ” they shouted . “ Help ! This is the man who goes everywhere teaching everyone against the people of Israel , the Law of Moses , and this Temple . And now he has even brought some Gentiles into the Temple and defiled this holy place ! ” (
44021029	They said this because they had seen Trophimus from Ephesus with Paul in the city , and they thought that Paul had taken him into the Temple . )
44021030	Confusion spread through the whole city , and the people all ran together , grabbed Paul , and dragged him out of the Temple . At once the Temple doors were closed .
44021031	The mob was trying to kill Paul , when a report was sent up to the commander of the Roman troops that all of Jerusalem was rioting .
44021032	At once the commander took some officers and soldiers and rushed down to the crowd . When the people saw him with the soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	The commander went over to Paul , arrested him , and ordered him to be bound with two chains . Then he asked , “ Who is this man , and what has he done ? ”
44021034	Some in the crowd shouted one thing , others something else . There was such confusion that the commander could not find out exactly what had happened , so he ordered his men to take Paul up into the fort .
44021035	They got as far as the steps with him , and then the soldiers had to carry him because the mob was so wild .
44021036	They were all coming after him and screaming , “ Kill him ! ”
44021037	As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the fort , he spoke to the commander : “ May I say something to you ? ” “ You speak Greek , do you ? ” the commander asked .
44021038	“ Then you are not that Egyptian fellow who some time ago started a revolution and led four thousand armed terrorists out into the desert ? ”
44021039	Paul answered , “ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of an important city . Please let me speak to the people . ”
44021040	The commander gave him permission , so Paul stood on the steps and motioned with his hand for the people to be silent . When they were quiet , Paul spoke to them in Hebrew :
44022001	“ My fellow Jews , listen to me as I make my defense before you ! ”
44022002	When they heard him speaking to them in Hebrew , they became even quieter ; and Paul went on :
44022003	“ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus in Cilicia , but brought up here in Jerusalem as a student of Gamaliel . I received strict instruction in the Law of our ancestors and was just as dedicated to God as are all of you who are here today .
44022004	I persecuted to the death the people who followed this Way . I arrested men and women and threw them into prison .
44022005	The High Priest and the whole Council can prove that I am telling the truth . I received from them letters written to fellow Jews in Damascus , so I went there to arrest these people and bring them back in chains to Jerusalem to be punished .
44022006	“ As I was traveling and coming near Damascus , about midday a bright light from the sky flashed suddenly around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Saul , Saul ! Why do you persecute me ? ’
44022008	‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ I asked . ‘ I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom you persecute , ’ he said to me .
44022009	The men with me saw the light , but did not hear the voice of the one who was speaking to me .
44022010	I asked , ‘ What shall I do , Lord ? ’ and the Lord said to me , ‘ Get up and go into Damascus , and there you will be told everything that God has determined for you to do . ’
44022011	I was blind because of the bright light , and so my companions took me by the hand and led me into Damascus .
44022012	“ In that city was a man named Ananias , a religious man who obeyed our Law and was highly respected by all the Jews living there .
44022013	He came to me , stood by me , and said , ‘ Brother Saul , see again ! ’ At that very moment I saw again and looked at him .
44022014	He said , ‘ The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will , to see his righteous Servant , and to hear him speaking with his own voice .
44022015	For you will be a witness for him to tell everyone what you have seen and heard .
44022016	And now , why wait any longer ? Get up and be baptized and have your sins washed away by praying to him . ’
44022017	“ I went back to Jerusalem , and while I was praying in the Temple , I had a vision ,
44022018	in which I saw the Lord , as he said to me , ‘ Hurry and leave Jerusalem quickly , because the people here will not accept your witness about me . ’
44022019	‘ Lord , ’ I answered , ‘ they know very well that I went to the synagogues and arrested and beat those who believe in you .
44022020	And when your witness Stephen was put to death , I myself was there , approving of his murder and taking care of the cloaks of his murderers . ’
44022021	‘ Go , ’ the Lord said to me , ‘ for I will send you far away to the Gentiles . ’ ”
44022022	The people listened to Paul until he said this ; but then they started shouting at the top of their voices , “ Away with him ! Kill him ! He's not fit to live ! ”
44022023	They were screaming , waving their clothes , and throwing dust up in the air .
44022024	The Roman commander ordered his men to take Paul into the fort , and he told them to whip him in order to find out why the Jews were screaming like this against him .
44022025	But when they had tied him up to be whipped , Paul said to the officer standing there , “ Is it lawful for you to whip a Roman citizen who hasn't even been tried for any crime ? ”
44022026	When the officer heard this , he went to the commander and asked him , “ What are you doing ? That man is a Roman citizen ! ”
44022027	So the commander went to Paul and asked him , “ Tell me , are you a Roman citizen ? ” “ Yes , ” answered Paul .
44022028	The commander said , “ I became one by paying a large amount of money . ” “ But I am one by birth , ” Paul answered .
44022029	At once the men who were going to question Paul drew back from him ; and the commander was frightened when he realized that Paul was a Roman citizen and that he had put him in chains .
44022030	The commander wanted to find out for sure what the Jews were accusing Paul of ; so the next day he had Paul's chains taken off and ordered the chief priests and the whole Council to meet . Then he took Paul and made him stand before them .
44023001	Paul looked straight at the Council and said , “ My fellow Israelites ! My conscience is perfectly clear about the way in which I have lived before God to this very day . ”
44023002	The High Priest Ananias ordered those who were standing close to Paul to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Paul said to him , “ God will certainly strike you—you whitewashed wall ! You sit there to judge me according to the Law , yet you break the Law by ordering them to strike me ! ”
44023004	The men close to Paul said to him , “ You are insulting God's High Priest ! ”
44023005	Paul answered , “ My fellow Israelites , I did not know that he was the High Priest . The scripture says , ‘ You must not speak evil of the ruler of your people . ’ ”
44023006	When Paul saw that some of the group were Sadducees and the others were Pharisees , he called out in the Council , “ Fellow Israelites ! I am a Pharisee , the son of Pharisees . I am on trial here because of the hope I have that the dead will rise to life ! ”
44023007	As soon as he said this , the Pharisees and Sadducees started to quarrel , and the group was divided . (
44023008	For the Sadducees say that people will not rise from death and that there are no angels or spirits ; but the Pharisees believe in all three . )
44023009	The shouting became louder , and some of the teachers of the Law who belonged to the party of the Pharisees stood up and protested strongly : “ We cannot find a thing wrong with this man ! Perhaps a spirit or an angel really did speak to him ! ”
44023010	The argument became so violent that the commander was afraid that Paul would be torn to pieces . So he ordered his soldiers to go down into the group , get Paul away from them , and take him into the fort .
44023011	That night the Lord stood by Paul and said , “ Don't be afraid ! You have given your witness for me here in Jerusalem , and you must also do the same in Rome . ”
44023012	The next morning some Jews met together and made a plan . They took a vow that they would not eat or drink anything until they had killed Paul .
44023013	There were more than forty who planned this together .
44023014	Then they went to the chief priests and elders and said , “ We have taken a solemn vow together not to eat a thing until we have killed Paul .
44023015	Now then , you and the Council send word to the Roman commander to bring Paul down to you , pretending that you want to get more accurate information about him . But we will be ready to kill him before he ever gets here . ”
44023016	But the son of Paul's sister heard about the plot ; so he went to the fort and told Paul .
44023017	Then Paul called one of the officers and said to him , “ Take this young man to the commander ; he has something to tell him . ”
44023018	The officer took him , led him to the commander , and said , “ The prisoner Paul called me and asked me to bring this young man to you , because he has something to say to you . ”
44023019	The commander took him by the hand , led him off by himself , and asked him , “ What do you have to tell me ? ”
44023020	He said , “ The Jewish authorities have agreed to ask you tomorrow to take Paul down to the Council , pretending that the Council wants to get more accurate information about him .
44023021	But don't listen to them , because there are more than forty men who will be hiding and waiting for him . They have taken a vow not to eat or drink until they have killed him . They are now ready to do it and are waiting for your decision . ”
44023022	The commander said , “ Don't tell anyone that you have reported this to me . ” And he sent the young man away .
44023023	Then the commander called two of his officers and said , “ Get two hundred soldiers ready to go to Caesarea , together with seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen , and be ready to leave by nine o'clock tonight .
44023024	Provide some horses for Paul to ride and get him safely through to Governor Felix . ”
44023025	Then the commander wrote a letter that went like this :
44023026	“ Claudius Lysias to His Excellency , Governor Felix : Greetings .
44023027	The Jews seized this man and were about to kill him . I learned that he is a Roman citizen , so I went with my soldiers and rescued him .
44023028	I wanted to know what they were accusing him of , so I took him down to their Council .
44023029	I found out that he had not done a thing for which he deserved to die or be put in prison ; the accusation against him had to do with questions about their own law .
44023030	And when I was informed that there was a plot against him , at once I decided to send him to you . I have told his accusers to make their charges against him before you . ”
44023031	The soldiers carried out their orders . They got Paul and took him that night as far as Antipatris .
44023032	The next day the foot soldiers returned to the fort and left the horsemen to go on with him .
44023033	They took him to Caesarea , delivered the letter to the governor , and turned Paul over to him .
44023034	The governor read the letter and asked Paul what province he was from . When he found out that he was from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , “ I will hear you when your accusers arrive . ” Then he gave orders for Paul to be kept under guard in the governor's headquarters .
44024001	Five days later the High Priest Ananias went to Caesarea with some elders and a lawyer named Tertullus . They appeared before Governor Felix and made their charges against Paul .
44024002	Then Paul was called in , and Tertullus began to make his accusation , as follows : “ Your Excellency ! Your wise leadership has brought us a long period of peace , and many necessary reforms are being made for the good of our country .
44024003	We welcome this everywhere and at all times , and we are deeply grateful to you .
44024004	I do not want to take up too much of your time , however , so I beg you to be kind and listen to our brief account .
44024005	We found this man to be a dangerous nuisance ; he starts riots among Jews all over the world and is a leader of the party of the Nazarenes .
44024006	He also tried to defile the Temple , and we arrested him .
44024008	If you question this man , you yourself will be able to learn from him all the things that we are accusing him of . ”
44024009	The Jews joined in the accusation and said that all this was true .
44024010	The governor then motioned to Paul to speak , and Paul said , “ I know that you have been a judge over this nation for many years , and so I am happy to defend myself before you .
44024011	As you can find out for yourself , it was no more than twelve days ago that I went to Jerusalem to worship .
44024012	The Jews did not find me arguing with anyone in the Temple , nor did they find me stirring up the people , either in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city .
44024013	Nor can they give you proof of the accusations they now bring against me .
44024014	I do admit this to you : I worship the God of our ancestors by following that Way which they say is false . But I also believe in everything written in the Law of Moses and the books of the prophets .
44024015	I have the same hope in God that these themselves have , namely , that all people , both the good and the bad , will rise from death .
44024016	And so I do my best always to have a clear conscience before God and people .
44024017	“ After being away from Jerusalem for several years , I went there to take some money to my own people and to offer sacrifices .
44024018	It was while I was doing this that they found me in the Temple after I had completed the ceremony of purification . There was no crowd with me and no disorder .
44024019	But some Jews from the province of Asia were there ; they themselves ought to come before you and make their accusations if they have anything against me .
44024020	Or let these who are here tell what crime they found me guilty of when I stood before the Council—
44024021	except for the one thing I called out when I stood before them : ‘ I am being tried by you today for believing that the dead will rise to life . ’ ”
44024022	Then Felix , who was well informed about the Way , brought the hearing to a close . “ When the commander Lysias arrives , ” he told them , “ I will decide your case . ”
