44024023	He ordered the officer in charge of Paul to keep him under guard , but to give him some freedom and allow his friends to provide for his needs .
44024024	After some days Felix came with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish . He sent for Paul and listened to him as he talked about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	But as Paul went on discussing about goodness , self-control , and the coming Day of Judgment , Felix was afraid and said , “ You may leave now . I will call you again when I get the chance . ”
44024026	At the same time he was hoping that Paul would give him some money ; and for this reason he would call for him often and talk with him .
44024027	After two years had passed , Porcius Festus succeeded Felix as governor . Felix wanted to gain favor with the Jews so he left Paul in prison .
44025001	Three days after Festus arrived in the province , he went from Caesarea to Jerusalem ,
44025002	where the chief priests and the Jewish leaders brought their charges against Paul . They begged Festus
44025003	to do them the favor of having Paul come to Jerusalem , for they had made a plot to kill him on the way .
44025004	Festus answered , “ Paul is being kept a prisoner in Caesarea , and I myself will be going back there soon .
44025005	Let your leaders go to Caesarea with me and accuse the man if he has done anything wrong . ”
44025006	Festus spent another eight or ten days with them and then went to Caesarea . On the next day he sat down in the judgment court and ordered Paul to be brought in .
44025007	When Paul arrived , the Jews who had come from Jerusalem stood around him and started making many serious charges against him , which they were not able to prove .
44025008	But Paul defended himself : “ I have done nothing wrong against the Law of the Jews or against the Temple or against the Roman Emperor . ”
44025009	But Festus wanted to gain favor with the Jews , so he asked Paul , “ Would you be willing to go to Jerusalem and be tried on these charges before me there ? ”
44025010	Paul said , “ I am standing before the Emperor's own judgment court , where I should be tried . I have done no wrong to the Jews , as you yourself well know .
44025011	If I have broken the law and done something for which I deserve the death penalty , I do not ask to escape it . But if there is no truth in the charges they bring against me , no one can hand me over to them . I appeal to the Emperor . ”
44025012	Then Festus , after conferring with his advisers , answered , “ You have appealed to the Emperor , so to the Emperor you will go . ”
44025013	Some time later King Agrippa and Bernice came to Caesarea to pay a visit of welcome to Festus .
44025014	After they had been there several days , Festus explained Paul's situation to the king : “ There is a man here who was left a prisoner by Felix ;
44025015	and when I went to Jerusalem , the Jewish chief priests and elders brought charges against him and asked me to condemn him .
44025016	But I told them that we Romans are not in the habit of handing over any who are accused of a crime before they have met their accusers face-to-face and have had the chance of defending themselves against the accusation .
44025017	When they came here , then , I lost no time , but on the very next day I sat in the judgment court and ordered the man to be brought in .
44025018	His opponents stood up , but they did not accuse him of any of the evil crimes that I thought they would .
44025019	All they had were some arguments with him about their own religion and about a man named Jesus , who has died ; but Paul claims that he is alive .
44025020	I was undecided about how I could get information on these matters , so I asked Paul if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem and be tried there on these charges .
44025021	But Paul appealed ; he asked to be kept under guard and to let the Emperor decide his case . So I gave orders for him to be kept under guard until I could send him to the Emperor . ”
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus , “ I would like to hear this man myself . ” “ You will hear him tomorrow , ” Festus answered .
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and ceremony and entered the audience hall with the military chiefs and the leading men of the city . Festus gave the order , and Paul was brought in .
44025024	Festus said , “ King Agrippa and all who are here with us : You see this man against whom all the Jewish people , both here and in Jerusalem , have brought complaints to me . They scream that he should not live any longer .
44025025	But I could not find that he had done anything for which he deserved the death sentence . And since he himself made an appeal to the Emperor , I have decided to send him .
44025026	But I have nothing definite about him to write to the Emperor . So I have brought him here before you—and especially before you , King Agrippa ! —so that , after investigating his case , I may have something to write .
44025027	For it seems unreasonable to me to send a prisoner without clearly indicating the charges against him . ”
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , “ You have permission to speak on your own behalf . ” Paul stretched out his hand and defended himself as follows :
44026002	“ King Agrippa ! I consider myself fortunate that today I am to defend myself before you from all the things these Jews accuse me of ,
44026003	particularly since you know so well all the Jewish customs and disputes . I ask you , then , to listen to me with patience .
44026004	“ All the Jews know how I have lived ever since I was young . They know how I have spent my whole life , at first in my own country and then in Jerusalem .
44026005	They have always known , if they are willing to testify , that from the very first I have lived as a member of the strictest party of our religion , the Pharisees .
44026006	And now I stand here to be tried because of the hope I have in the promise that God made to our ancestors—
44026007	the very thing that the twelve tribes of our people hope to receive , as they worship God day and night . And it is because of this hope , Your Majesty , that I am being accused by these Jews !
44026008	Why do you who are here find it impossible to believe that God raises the dead ?
44026009	“ I myself thought that I should do everything I could against the cause of Jesus of Nazareth .
44026010	That is what I did in Jerusalem . I received authority from the chief priests and put many of God's people in prison ; and when they were sentenced to death , I also voted against them .
44026011	Many times I had them punished in the synagogues and tried to make them deny their faith . I was so furious with them that I even went to foreign cities to persecute them .
44026012	“ It was for this purpose that I went to Damascus with authority and orders from the chief priests .
44026013	It was on the road at midday , Your Majesty , that I saw a light much brighter than the sun , coming from the sky and shining around me and the men traveling with me .
44026014	All of us fell to the ground , and I heard a voice say to me in Hebrew , ‘ Saul , Saul ! Why are you persecuting me ? You are hurting yourself by hitting back , like an ox kicking against its owner's stick . ’
44026015	‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ I asked . And the Lord answered , ‘ I am Jesus , whom you persecute .
44026016	But get up and stand on your feet . I have appeared to you to appoint you as my servant . You are to tell others what you have seen of me today and what I will show you in the future .
44026017	I will rescue you from the people of Israel and from the Gentiles to whom I will send you .
44026018	You are to open their eyes and turn them from the darkness to the light and from the power of Satan to God , so that through their faith in me they will have their sins forgiven and receive their place among God's chosen people . ’
44026019	“ And so , King Agrippa , I did not disobey the vision I had from heaven .
44026020	First in Damascus and in Jerusalem and then in the whole country of Israel and among the Gentiles , I preached that they must repent of their sins and turn to God and do the things that would show they had repented .
44026021	It was for this reason that these Jews seized me while I was in the Temple , and they tried to kill me .
44026022	But to this very day I have been helped by God , and so I stand here giving my witness to all , to small and great alike . What I say is the very same thing which the prophets and Moses said was going to happen :
44026023	that the Messiah must suffer and be the first one to rise from death , to announce the light of salvation to the Jews and to the Gentiles . ”
44026024	As Paul defended himself in this way , Festus shouted at him , “ You are mad , Paul ! Your great learning is driving you mad ! ”
44026025	Paul answered , “ I am not mad , Your Excellency ! I am speaking the sober truth .
44026026	King Agrippa ! I can speak to you with all boldness , because you know about these things . I am sure that you have taken notice of every one of them , for this thing has not happened hidden away in a corner .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe the prophets ? I know that you do ! ”
44026028	Agrippa said to Paul , “ In this short time do you think you will make me a Christian ? ”
44026029	“ Whether a short time or a long time , ” Paul answered , “ my prayer to God is that you and all the rest of you who are listening to me today might become what I am—except , of course , for these chains ! ”
44026030	Then the king , the governor , Bernice , and all the others got up ,
44026031	and after leaving they said to each other , “ This man has not done anything for which he should die or be put in prison . ”
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ This man could have been released if he had not appealed to the Emperor . ”
44027001	When it was decided that we should sail to Italy , they handed Paul and some other prisoners over to Julius , an officer in the Roman army regiment called “ The Emperor's Regiment . ”
44027002	We went aboard a ship from Adramyttium , which was ready to leave for the seaports of the province of Asia , and we sailed away . Aristarchus , a Macedonian from Thessalonica , was with us .
44027003	The next day we arrived at Sidon . Julius was kind to Paul and allowed him to go and see his friends , to be given what he needed .
44027004	We went on from there , and because the winds were blowing against us , we sailed on the sheltered side of the island of Cyprus .
44027005	We crossed over the sea off Cilicia and Pamphylia and came to Myra in Lycia .
44027006	There the officer found a ship from Alexandria that was going to sail for Italy , so he put us aboard .
44027007	We sailed slowly for several days and with great difficulty finally arrived off the town of Cnidus . The wind would not let us go any farther in that direction , so we sailed down the sheltered side of the island of Crete , passing by Cape Salmone .
44027008	We kept close to the coast and with great difficulty came to a place called Safe Harbors , not far from the town of Lasea .
44027009	We spent a long time there , until it became dangerous to continue the voyage , for by now the Day of Atonement was already past . So Paul gave them this advice :
44027010	“ Men , I see that our voyage from here on will be dangerous ; there will be great damage to the cargo and to the ship , and loss of life as well . ”
44027011	But the army officer was convinced by what the captain and the owner of the ship said , and not by what Paul said .
44027012	The harbor was not a good one to spend the winter in ; so almost everyone was in favor of putting out to sea and trying to reach Phoenix , if possible , in order to spend the winter there . Phoenix is a harbor in Crete that faces southwest and northwest .
44027013	A soft wind from the south began to blow , and the men thought that they could carry out their plan , so they pulled up the anchor and sailed as close as possible along the coast of Crete .
44027014	But soon a very strong wind—the one called “ Northeaster ” —blew down from the island .
44027015	It hit the ship , and since it was impossible to keep the ship headed into the wind , we gave up trying and let it be carried along by the wind .
44027016	We got some shelter when we passed to the south of the little island of Cauda . There , with some difficulty we managed to make the ship's boat secure .
44027017	They pulled it aboard and then fastened some ropes tight around the ship . They were afraid that they might run into the sandbanks off the coast of Libya , so they lowered the sail and let the ship be carried by the wind .
44027018	The violent storm continued , so on the next day they began to throw some of the ship's cargo overboard ,
44027019	and on the following day they threw part of the ship's equipment overboard .
44027020	For many days we could not see the sun or the stars , and the wind kept on blowing very hard . We finally gave up all hope of being saved .
44027021	After everyone had gone a long time without food , Paul stood before them and said , “ You should have listened to me and not have sailed from Crete ; then we would have avoided all this damage and loss .
44027022	But now I beg you , take courage ! Not one of you will lose your life ; only the ship will be lost .
44027023	For last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I worship came to me
44027024	and said , ‘ Don't be afraid , Paul ! You must stand before the Emperor . And God in his goodness to you has spared the lives of all those who are sailing with you . ’
44027025	So take courage , men ! For I trust in God that it will be just as I was told .
44027026	But we will be driven ashore on some island . ”
44027027	It was the fourteenth night , and we were being driven in the Mediterranean by the storm . About midnight the sailors suspected that we were getting close to land .
44027028	So they dropped a line with a weight tied to it and found that the water was one hundred and twenty feet deep ; a little later they did the same and found that it was ninety feet deep .
44027029	They were afraid that the ship would go on the rocks , so they lowered four anchors from the back of the ship and prayed for daylight .
44027030	Then the sailors tried to escape from the ship ; they lowered the boat into the water and pretended that they were going to put out some anchors from the front of the ship .
44027031	But Paul said to the army officer and soldiers , “ If the sailors don't stay on board , you have no hope of being saved . ”
44027032	So the soldiers cut the ropes that held the boat and let it go .
44027033	Just before dawn , Paul begged them all to eat some food : “ You have been waiting for fourteen days now , and all this time you have not eaten a thing .
44027034	I beg you , then , eat some food ; you need it in order to survive . Not even a hair of your heads will be lost . ”
44027035	After saying this , Paul took some bread , gave thanks to God before them all , broke it , and began to eat .
44027036	They took courage , and every one of them also ate some food .
44027037	There was a total of 276 of us on board .
44027038	After everyone had eaten enough , they lightened the ship by throwing all the wheat into the sea .
44027039	When day came , the sailors did not recognize the coast , but they noticed a bay with a beach and decided that , if possible , they would run the ship aground there .
44027040	So they cut off the anchors and let them sink in the sea , and at the same time they untied the ropes that held the steering oars . Then they raised the sail at the front of the ship so that the wind would blow the ship forward , and we headed for shore .
44027041	But the ship hit a sandbank and went aground ; the front part of the ship got stuck and could not move , while the back part was being broken to pieces by the violence of the waves .
44027042	The soldiers made a plan to kill all the prisoners , in order to keep them from swimming ashore and escaping .
44027043	But the army officer wanted to save Paul , so he stopped them from doing this . Instead , he ordered everyone who could swim to jump overboard first and swim ashore ;
44027044	the rest were to follow , holding on to the planks or to some broken pieces of the ship . And this was how we all got safely ashore .
44028001	When we were safely ashore , we learned that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The natives there were very friendly to us . It had started to rain and was cold , so they built a fire and made us all welcome .
44028003	Paul gathered up a bundle of sticks and was putting them on the fire when a snake came out on account of the heat and fastened itself to his hand .
44028004	The natives saw the snake hanging on Paul's hand and said to one another , “ This man must be a murderer , but Fate will not let him live , even though he escaped from the sea . ”
44028005	But Paul shook the snake off into the fire without being harmed at all .
44028006	They were waiting for him to swell up or suddenly fall down dead . But after waiting for a long time and not seeing anything unusual happening to him , they changed their minds and said , “ He is a god ! ”
44028007	Not far from that place were some fields that belonged to Publius , the chief of the island . He welcomed us kindly and for three days we were his guests .
44028008	Publius' father was in bed , sick with fever and dysentery . Paul went into his room , prayed , placed his hands on him , and healed him .
44028009	When this happened , all the other sick people on the island came and were healed .
44028010	They gave us many gifts , and when we sailed , they put on board what we needed for the voyage .
44028011	After three months we sailed away on a ship from Alexandria , called “ The Twin Gods , ” which had spent the winter in the island .
44028012	We arrived in the city of Syracuse and stayed there for three days .
44028013	From there we sailed on and arrived in the city of Rhegium . The next day a wind began to blow from the south , and in two days we came to the town of Puteoli .
44028014	We found some believers there who asked us to stay with them a week . And so we came to Rome .
44028015	The believers in Rome heard about us and came as far as the towns of Market of Appius and Three Inns to meet us . When Paul saw them , he thanked God and was greatly encouraged .
44028016	When we arrived in Rome , Paul was allowed to live by himself with a soldier guarding him .
44028017	After three days Paul called the local Jewish leaders to a meeting . When they had gathered , he said to them , “ My fellow Israelites , even though I did nothing against our people or the customs that we received from our ancestors , I was made a prisoner in Jerusalem and handed over to the Romans .
44028018	After questioning me , the Romans wanted to release me , because they found that I had done nothing for which I deserved to die .
44028019	But when the Jews opposed this , I was forced to appeal to the Emperor , even though I had no accusation to make against my own people .
44028020	That is why I asked to see you and talk with you . As a matter of fact , I am bound in chains like this for the sake of him for whom the people of Israel hope . ”
44028021	They said to him , “ We have not received any letters from Judea about you , nor have any of our people come from there with any news or anything bad to say about you .
44028022	But we would like to hear your ideas , because we know that everywhere people speak against this party to which you belong . ”
44028023	So they set a date with Paul , and a large number of them came that day to the place where Paul was staying . From morning till night he explained to them his message about the Kingdom of God , and he tried to convince them about Jesus by quoting from the Law of Moses and the writings of the prophets .
44028024	Some of them were convinced by his words , but others would not believe .
44028025	So they left , disagreeing among themselves , after Paul had said this one thing : “ How well the Holy Spirit spoke through the prophet Isaiah to your ancestors !
44028026	For he said , ‘ Go and say to this people : You will listen and listen , but not understand ; you will look and look , but not see ,
44028027	because this people's minds are dull , and they have stopped up their ears and closed their eyes . Otherwise , their eyes would see , their ears would hear , their minds would understand , and they would turn to me , says God , and I would heal them . ’ ”
44028028	And Paul concluded : “ You are to know , then , that God's message of salvation has been sent to the Gentiles . They will listen ! ”
44028030	For two years Paul lived in a place he rented for himself , and there he welcomed all who came to see him .
44028031	He preached about the Kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ , speaking with all boldness and freedom .
45001001	From Paul , a servant of Christ Jesus and an apostle chosen and called by God to preach his Good News .
45001002	The Good News was promised long ago by God through his prophets , as written in the Holy Scriptures .
45001003	It is about his Son , our Lord Jesus Christ : as to his humanity , he was born a descendant of David ;
45001004	as to his divine holiness , he was shown with great power to be the Son of God by being raised from death .
45001005	Through him God gave me the privilege of being an apostle for the sake of Christ , in order to lead people of all nations to believe and obey .
45001006	This also includes you who are in Rome , whom God has called to belong to Jesus Christ .
45001007	And so I write to all of you in Rome whom God loves and has called to be his own people : May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace .
45001008	First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you , because the whole world is hearing about your faith .
45001009	God is my witness that what I say is true—the God whom I serve with all my heart by preaching the Good News about his Son . God knows that I remember you
45001010	every time I pray . I ask that God in his good will may at last make it possible for me to visit you now .
45001011	For I want very much to see you , in order to share a spiritual blessing with you to make you strong .
45001012	What I mean is that both you and I will be helped at the same time , you by my faith and I by yours .
45001013	You must remember , my friends , that many times I have planned to visit you , but something has always kept me from doing so . I want to win converts among you also , as I have among other Gentiles .
45001014	For I have an obligation to all peoples , to the civilized and to the savage , to the educated and to the ignorant .
45001015	So then , I am eager to preach the Good News to you also who live in Rome .
45001016	I have complete confidence in the gospel ; it is God's power to save all who believe , first the Jews and also the Gentiles .
45001017	For the gospel reveals how God puts people right with himself : it is through faith from beginning to end . As the scripture says , “ The person who is put right with God through faith shall live . ”
45001018	God's anger is revealed from heaven against all the sin and evil of the people whose evil ways prevent the truth from being known .
45001019	God punishes them , because what can be known about God is plain to them , for God himself made it plain .
45001020	Ever since God created the world , his invisible qualities , both his eternal power and his divine nature , have been clearly seen ; they are perceived in the things that God has made . So those people have no excuse at all !
45001021	They know God , but they do not give him the honor that belongs to him , nor do they thank him . Instead , their thoughts have become complete nonsense , and their empty minds are filled with darkness .
45001022	They say they are wise , but they are fools ;
45001023	instead of worshiping the immortal God , they worship images made to look like mortals or birds or animals or reptiles .
45001024	And so God has given those people over to do the filthy things their hearts desire , and they do shameful things with each other .
45001025	They exchange the truth about God for a lie ; they worship and serve what God has created instead of the Creator himself , who is to be praised forever ! Amen .
45001026	Because they do this , God has given them over to shameful passions . Even the women pervert the natural use of their sex by unnatural acts .
45001027	In the same way the men give up natural sexual relations with women and burn with passion for each other . Men do shameful things with each other , and as a result they bring upon themselves the punishment they deserve for their wrongdoing .
45001028	Because those people refuse to keep in mind the true knowledge about God , he has given them over to corrupted minds , so that they do the things that they should not do .
45001029	They are filled with all kinds of wickedness , evil , greed , and vice ; they are full of jealousy , murder , fighting , deceit , and malice . They gossip
45001030	and speak evil of one another ; they are hateful to God , insolent , proud , and boastful ; they think of more ways to do evil ; they disobey their parents ;
45001031	they have no conscience ; they do not keep their promises , and they show no kindness or pity for others .
45001032	They know that God's law says that people who live in this way deserve death . Yet , not only do they continue to do these very things , but they even approve of others who do them .
45002001	Do you , my friend , pass judgment on others ? You have no excuse at all , whoever you are . For when you judge others and then do the same things which they do , you condemn yourself .
45002002	We know that God is right when he judges the people who do such things as these .
45002003	But you , my friend , do those very things for which you pass judgment on others ! Do you think you will escape God's judgment ?
45002004	Or perhaps you despise his great kindness , tolerance , and patience . Surely you know that God is kind , because he is trying to lead you to repent .
45002005	But you have a hard and stubborn heart , and so you are making your own punishment even greater on the Day when God's anger and righteous judgments will be revealed .
45002006	For God will reward each of us according to what we have done .
45002007	Some people keep on doing good , and seek glory , honor , and immortal life ; to them God will give eternal life .
45002008	Other people are selfish and reject what is right , in order to follow what is wrong ; on them God will pour out his anger and fury .
45002009	There will be suffering and pain for all those who do what is evil , for the Jews first and also for the Gentiles .
45002010	But God will give glory , honor , and peace to all who do what is good , to the Jews first and also to the Gentiles .
45002011	For God judges everyone by the same standard .
45002012	The Gentiles do not have the Law of Moses ; they sin and are lost apart from the Law . The Jews have the Law ; they sin and are judged by the Law .
45002013	For it is not by hearing the Law that people are put right with God , but by doing what the Law commands .
45002014	The Gentiles do not have the Law ; but whenever they do by instinct what the Law commands , they are their own law , even though they do not have the Law .
45002015	Their conduct shows that what the Law commands is written in their hearts . Their consciences also show that this is true , since their thoughts sometimes accuse them and sometimes defend them .
45002016	And so , according to the Good News I preach , this is how it will be on that Day when God through Jesus Christ will judge the secret thoughts of all .
45002017	What about you ? You call yourself a Jew ; you depend on the Law and boast about God ;
45002018	you know what God wants you to do , and you have learned from the Law to choose what is right ;
45002019	you are sure that you are a guide for the blind , a light for those who are in darkness ,
45002020	an instructor for the foolish , and a teacher for the ignorant . You are certain that in the Law you have the full content of knowledge and of truth .
45002021	You teach others—why don't you teach yourself ? You preach , “ Do not steal ” —but do you yourself steal ?
45002022	You say , “ Do not commit adultery ” —but do you commit adultery ? You detest idols—but do you rob temples ?
45002023	You boast about having God's law—but do you bring shame on God by breaking his law ?
45002024	The scripture says , “ Because of you Jews , the Gentiles speak evil of God . ”
45002025	If you obey the Law , your circumcision is of value ; but if you disobey the Law , you might as well never have been circumcised .
45002026	If the Gentile , who is not circumcised , obeys the commands of the Law , will not God regard him as though he were circumcised ?
45002027	And so you Jews will be condemned by the Gentiles because you break the Law , even though you have it written down and are circumcised ; but they obey the Law , even though they are not physically circumcised .
45002028	After all , who is a real Jew , truly circumcised ? It is not the man who is a Jew on the outside , whose circumcision is a physical thing .
45002029	Rather , the real Jew is the person who is a Jew on the inside , that is , whose heart has been circumcised , and this is the work of God's Spirit , not of the written Law . Such a person receives praise from God , not from human beings .
45003001	Do the Jews then have any advantage over the Gentiles ? Or is there any value in being circumcised ?
45003002	Much , indeed , in every way ! In the first place , God trusted his message to the Jews .
45003003	But what if some of them were not faithful ? Does this mean that God will not be faithful ?
45003004	Certainly not ! God must be true , even though all human beings are liars . As the scripture says , “ You must be shown to be right when you speak ; you must win your case when you are being tried . ”
45003005	But what if our doing wrong serves to show up more clearly God's doing right ? Can we say that God does wrong when he punishes us ? ( This would be the natural question to ask . )
45003006	By no means ! If God is not just , how can he judge the world ?
45003007	But what if my untruth serves God's glory by making his truth stand out more clearly ? Why should I still be condemned as a sinner ?
45003008	Why not say , then , “ Let us do evil so that good may come ” ? Some people , indeed , have insulted me by accusing me of saying this very thing ! They will be condemned , as they should be .
45003009	Well then , are we Jews in any better condition than the Gentiles ? Not at all ! I have already shown that Jews and Gentiles alike are all under the power of sin .
45003010	As the Scriptures say : “ There is no one who is righteous ,
45003011	no one who is wise or who worships God .
45003012	All have turned away from God ; they have all gone wrong ; no one does what is right , not even one .
45003013	Their words are full of deadly deceit ; wicked lies roll off their tongues , and dangerous threats , like snake's poison , from their lips ;
45003014	their speech is filled with bitter curses .
45003015	They are quick to hurt and kill ;
45003016	they leave ruin and destruction wherever they go .
45003017	They have not known the path of peace ,
45003018	nor have they learned reverence for God . ”
45003019	Now we know that everything in the Law applies to those who live under the Law , in order to stop all human excuses and bring the whole world under God's judgment .
45003020	For no one is put right in God's sight by doing what the Law requires ; what the Law does is to make us know that we have sinned .
45003021	But now God's way of putting people right with himself has been revealed . It has nothing to do with law , even though the Law of Moses and the prophets gave their witness to it .
45003022	God puts people right through their faith in Jesus Christ . God does this to all who believe in Christ , because there is no difference at all :
45003023	everyone has sinned and is far away from God's saving presence .
45003024	But by the free gift of God's grace all are put right with him through Christ Jesus , who sets them free .
45003027	What , then , can we boast about ? Nothing ! And what is the reason for this ? Is it that we obey the Law ? No , but that we believe .
45003028	For we conclude that a person is put right with God only through faith , and not by doing what the Law commands .
45003029	Or is God the God of the Jews only ? Is he not the God of the Gentiles also ? Of course he is .
45003030	God is one , and he will put the Jews right with himself on the basis of their faith , and will put the Gentiles right through their faith .
45003031	Does this mean that by this faith we do away with the Law ? No , not at all ; instead , we uphold the Law .
45004001	What shall we say , then , of Abraham , the father of our race ? What was his experience ?
45004002	If he was put right with God by the things he did , he would have something to boast about—but not in God's sight .
45004003	The scripture says , “ Abraham believed God , and because of his faith God accepted him as righteous . ”
45004004	A person who works is paid wages , but they are not regarded as a gift ; they are something that has been earned .
45004005	But those who depend on faith , not on deeds , and who believe in the God who declares the guilty to be innocent , it is this faith that God takes into account in order to put them right with himself .
45004006	This is what David meant when he spoke of the happiness of the person whom God accepts as righteous , apart from anything that person does :
45004007	“ Happy are those whose wrongs are forgiven , whose sins are pardoned !
45004008	Happy is the person whose sins the Lord will not keep account of ! ”
45004009	Does this happiness that David spoke of belong only to those who are circumcised ? No indeed ! It belongs also to those who are not circumcised . For we have quoted the scripture , “ Abraham believed God , and because of his faith God accepted him as righteous . ”
45004010	When did this take place ? Was it before or after Abraham was circumcised ? It was before , not after .
45004011	He was circumcised later , and his circumcision was a sign to show that because of his faith God had accepted him as righteous before he had been circumcised . And so Abraham is the spiritual father of all who believe in God and are accepted as righteous by him , even though they are not circumcised .
45004012	He is also the father of those who are circumcised , that is , of those who , in addition to being circumcised , also live the same life of faith that our father Abraham lived before he was circumcised .
45004013	When God promised Abraham and his descendants that the world would belong to him , he did so , not because Abraham obeyed the Law , but because he believed and was accepted as righteous by God .
45004014	For if what God promises is to be given to those who obey the Law , then faith means nothing and God's promise is worthless .
45004015	The Law brings down God's anger ; but where there is no law , there is no disobeying of the law .
45004016	And so the promise was based on faith , in order that the promise should be guaranteed as God's free gift to all of Abraham's descendants—not just to those who obey the Law , but also to those who believe as Abraham did . For Abraham is the spiritual father of us all ;
45004017	as the scripture says , “ I have made you father of many nations . ” So the promise is good in the sight of God , in whom Abraham believed—the God who brings the dead to life and whose command brings into being what did not exist .
45004018	Abraham believed and hoped , even when there was no reason for hoping , and so became “ the father of many nations . ” Just as the scripture says , “ Your descendants will be as many as the stars . ”
45004019	He was then almost one hundred years old ; but his faith did not weaken when he thought of his body , which was already practically dead , or of the fact that Sarah could not have children .
45004020	His faith did not leave him , and he did not doubt God's promise ; his faith filled him with power , and he gave praise to God .
45004021	He was absolutely sure that God would be able to do what he had promised .
45004022	That is why Abraham , through faith , “ was accepted as righteous by God . ”
45004023	The words “ he was accepted as righteous ” were not written for him alone .
45004024	They were written also for us who are to be accepted as righteous , who believe in him who raised Jesus our Lord from death .
45004025	Because of our sins he was given over to die , and he was raised to life in order to put us right with God .
45005001	Now that we have been put right with God through faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ .
45005002	He has brought us by faith into this experience of God's grace , in which we now live . And so we boast of the hope we have of sharing God's glory !
45005003	We also boast of our troubles , because we know that trouble produces endurance ,
45005004	endurance brings God's approval , and his approval creates hope .
45005005	This hope does not disappoint us , for God has poured out his love into our hearts by means of the Holy Spirit , who is God's gift to us .
45005006	For when we were still helpless , Christ died for the wicked at the time that God chose .
45005007	It is a difficult thing for someone to die for a righteous person . It may even be that someone might dare to die for a good person .
45005008	But God has shown us how much he loves us—it was while we were still sinners that Christ died for us !
45005009	By his blood we are now put right with God ; how much more , then , will we be saved by him from God's anger !
45005010	We were God's enemies , but he made us his friends through the death of his Son . Now that we are God's friends , how much more will we be saved by Christ's life !
45005011	But that is not all ; we rejoice because of what God has done through our Lord Jesus Christ , who has now made us God's friends .
45005012	Sin came into the world through one man , and his sin brought death with it . As a result , death has spread to the whole human race because everyone has sinned .
45005013	There was sin in the world before the Law was given ; but where there is no law , no account is kept of sins .
45005014	But from the time of Adam to the time of Moses , death ruled over all human beings , even over those who did not sin in the same way that Adam did when he disobeyed God's command . Adam was a figure of the one who was to come .
45005015	But the two are not the same , because God's free gift is not like Adam's sin . It is true that many people died because of the sin of that one man . But God's grace is much greater , and so is his free gift to so many people through the grace of the one man , Jesus Christ .
45005016	And there is a difference between God's gift and the sin of one man . After the one sin , came the judgment of “ Guilty ” ; but after so many sins , comes the undeserved gift of “ Not guilty ! ”
45005017	It is true that through the sin of one man death began to rule because of that one man . But how much greater is the result of what was done by the one man , Jesus Christ ! All who receive God's abundant grace and are freely put right with him will rule in life through Christ .
45005018	So then , as the one sin condemned all people , in the same way the one righteous act sets all people free and gives them life .
45005019	And just as all people were made sinners as the result of the disobedience of one man , in the same way they will all be put right with God as the result of the obedience of the one man .
45005020	Law was introduced in order to increase wrongdoing ; but where sin increased , God's grace increased much more .
45005021	So then , just as sin ruled by means of death , so also God's grace rules by means of righteousness , leading us to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	What shall we say , then ? Should we continue to live in sin so that God's grace will increase ?
45006002	Certainly not ! We have died to sin—how then can we go on living in it ?
45006003	For surely you know that when we were baptized into union with Christ Jesus , we were baptized into union with his death .
45006004	By our baptism , then , we were buried with him and shared his death , in order that , just as Christ was raised from death by the glorious power of the Father , so also we might live a new life .
45006005	For since we have become one with him in dying as he did , in the same way we shall be one with him by being raised to life as he was .
45006006	And we know that our old being has been put to death with Christ on his cross , in order that the power of the sinful self might be destroyed , so that we should no longer be the slaves of sin .
45006007	For when we die , we are set free from the power of sin .
45006008	Since we have died with Christ , we believe that we will also live with him .
45006009	For we know that Christ has been raised from death and will never die again—death will no longer rule over him .
45006010	And so , because he died , sin has no power over him ; and now he lives his life in fellowship with God .
45006011	In the same way you are to think of yourselves as dead , so far as sin is concerned , but living in fellowship with God through Christ Jesus .
45006012	Sin must no longer rule in your mortal bodies , so that you obey the desires of your natural self .
45006013	Nor must you surrender any part of yourselves to sin to be used for wicked purposes . Instead , give yourselves to God , as those who have been brought from death to life , and surrender your whole being to him to be used for righteous purposes .
45006014	Sin must not be your master ; for you do not live under law but under God's grace .
45006015	What , then ? Shall we sin , because we are not under law but under God's grace ? By no means !
45006016	Surely you know that when you surrender yourselves as slaves to obey someone , you are in fact the slaves of the master you obey—either of sin , which results in death , or of obedience , which results in being put right with God .
45006017	But thanks be to God ! For though at one time you were slaves to sin , you have obeyed with all your heart the truths found in the teaching you received .
45006018	You were set free from sin and became the slaves of righteousness .
45006019	( I use everyday language because of the weakness of your natural selves . ) At one time you surrendered yourselves entirely as slaves to impurity and wickedness for wicked purposes . In the same way you must now surrender yourselves entirely as slaves of righteousness for holy purposes .
45006020	When you were the slaves of sin , you were free from righteousness .
45006021	What did you gain from doing the things that you are now ashamed of ? The result of those things is death !
45006022	But now you have been set free from sin and are the slaves of God . Your gain is a life fully dedicated to him , and the result is eternal life .
45006023	For sin pays its wage—death ; but God's free gift is eternal life in union with Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Certainly you will understand what I am about to say , my friends , because all of you know about law . The law rules over people only as long as they live .
45007002	A married woman , for example , is bound by the law to her husband as long as he lives ; but if he dies , then she is free from the law that bound her to him .
45007003	So then , if she lives with another man while her husband is alive , she will be called an adulteress ; but if her husband dies , she is legally a free woman and does not commit adultery if she marries another man .
45007004	That is how it is with you , my friends . As far as the Law is concerned , you also have died because you are part of the body of Christ ; and now you belong to him who was raised from death in order that we might be useful in the service of God .
45007005	For when we lived according to our human nature , the sinful desires stirred up by the Law were at work in our bodies , and all we did ended in death .
45007006	Now , however , we are free from the Law , because we died to that which once held us prisoners . No longer do we serve in the old way of a written law , but in the new way of the Spirit .
45007007	Shall we say , then , that the Law itself is sinful ? Of course not ! But it was the Law that made me know what sin is . If the Law had not said , “ Do not desire what belongs to someone else , ” I would not have known such a desire .
45007008	But by means of that commandment sin found its chance to stir up all kinds of selfish desires in me . Apart from law , sin is a dead thing .
45007009	I myself was once alive apart from law ; but when the commandment came , sin sprang to life ,
45007010	and I died . And the commandment which was meant to bring life , in my case brought death .
45007011	Sin found its chance , and by means of the commandment it deceived me and killed me .
45007012	So then , the Law itself is holy , and the commandment is holy , right , and good .
45007013	But does this mean that what is good caused my death ? By no means ! It was sin that did it ; by using what is good , sin brought death to me , in order that its true nature as sin might be revealed . And so , by means of the commandment sin is shown to be even more terribly sinful .
45007014	We know that the Law is spiritual ; but I am a mortal , sold as a slave to sin .
45007015	I do not understand what I do ; for I don't do what I would like to do , but instead I do what I hate .
45007016	Since what I do is what I don't want to do , this shows that I agree that the Law is right .
45007017	So I am not really the one who does this thing ; rather it is the sin that lives in me .
45007018	I know that good does not live in me—that is , in my human nature . For even though the desire to do good is in me , I am not able to do it .
45007019	I don't do the good I want to do ; instead , I do the evil that I do not want to do .
45007020	If I do what I don't want to do , this means that I am no longer the one who does it ; instead , it is the sin that lives in me .
45007021	So I find that this law is at work : when I want to do what is good , what is evil is the only choice I have .
45007022	My inner being delights in the law of God .
45007023	But I see a different law at work in my body—a law that fights against the law which my mind approves of . It makes me a prisoner to the law of sin which is at work in my body .
45007024	What an unhappy man I am ! Who will rescue me from this body that is taking me to death ?
45007025	Thanks be to God , who does this through our Lord Jesus Christ ! This , then , is my condition : on my own I can serve God's law only with my mind , while my human nature serves the law of sin .
45008001	There is no condemnation now for those who live in union with Christ Jesus .
45008002	For the law of the Spirit , which brings us life in union with Christ Jesus , has set me free from the law of sin and death .
45008003	What the Law could not do , because human nature was weak , God did . He condemned sin in human nature by sending his own Son , who came with a nature like our sinful nature , to do away with sin .
45008004	God did this so that the righteous demands of the Law might be fully satisfied in us who live according to the Spirit , and not according to human nature .
45008005	Those who live as their human nature tells them to , have their minds controlled by what human nature wants . Those who live as the Spirit tells them to , have their minds controlled by what the Spirit wants .
45008006	To be controlled by human nature results in death ; to be controlled by the Spirit results in life and peace .
45008007	And so people become enemies of God when they are controlled by their human nature ; for they do not obey God's law , and in fact they cannot obey it .
45008008	Those who obey their human nature cannot please God .
45008009	But you do not live as your human nature tells you to ; instead , you live as the Spirit tells you to—if , in fact , God's Spirit lives in you . Whoever does not have the Spirit of Christ does not belong to him .
45008010	But if Christ lives in you , the Spirit is life for you because you have been put right with God , even though your bodies are going to die because of sin .
45008011	If the Spirit of God , who raised Jesus from death , lives in you , then he who raised Christ from death will also give life to your mortal bodies by the presence of his Spirit in you .
45008012	So then , my friends , we have an obligation , but it is not to live as our human nature wants us to .
45008013	For if you live according to your human nature , you are going to die ; but if by the Spirit you put to death your sinful actions , you will live .
45008014	Those who are led by God's Spirit are God's children .
45008015	For the Spirit that God has given you does not make you slaves and cause you to be afraid ; instead , the Spirit makes you God's children , and by the Spirit's power we cry out to God , “ Father ! my Father ! ”
45008016	God's Spirit joins himself to our spirits to declare that we are God's children .
45008017	Since we are his children , we will possess the blessings he keeps for his people , and we will also possess with Christ what God has kept for him ; for if we share Christ's suffering , we will also share his glory .
45008018	I consider that what we suffer at this present time cannot be compared at all with the glory that is going to be revealed to us .
45008019	All of creation waits with eager longing for God to reveal his children .
45008020	For creation was condemned to lose its purpose , not of its own will , but because God willed it to be so . Yet there was the hope
45008021	that creation itself would one day be set free from its slavery to decay and would share the glorious freedom of the children of God .
45008022	For we know that up to the present time all of creation groans with pain , like the pain of childbirth .
45008023	But it is not just creation alone which groans ; we who have the Spirit as the first of God's gifts also groan within ourselves as we wait for God to make us his children and set our whole being free .
45008024	For it was by hope that we were saved ; but if we see what we hope for , then it is not really hope . For who of us hopes for something we see ?
45008025	But if we hope for what we do not see , we wait for it with patience .
45008026	In the same way the Spirit also comes to help us , weak as we are . For we do not know how we ought to pray ; the Spirit himself pleads with God for us in groans that words cannot express .
45008027	And God , who sees into our hearts , knows what the thought of the Spirit is ; because the Spirit pleads with God on behalf of his people and in accordance with his will .
45008028	We know that in all things God works for good with those who love him , those whom he has called according to his purpose .
45008029	Those whom God had already chosen he also set apart to become like his Son , so that the Son would be the first among many believers .
45008030	And so those whom God set apart , he called ; and those he called , he put right with himself , and he shared his glory with them .
45008031	In view of all this , what can we say ? If God is for us , who can be against us ?
45008032	Certainly not God , who did not even keep back his own Son , but offered him for us all ! He gave us his Son—will he not also freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who will accuse God's chosen people ? God himself declares them not guilty !
45008034	Who , then , will condemn them ? Not Christ Jesus , who died , or rather , who was raised to life and is at the right side of God , pleading with him for us !
45008035	Who , then , can separate us from the love of Christ ? Can trouble do it , or hardship or persecution or hunger or poverty or danger or death ?
45008036	As the scripture says , “ For your sake we are in danger of death at all times ; we are treated like sheep that are going to be slaughtered . ”
45009001	I am speaking the truth ; I belong to Christ and I do not lie . My conscience , ruled by the Holy Spirit , also assures me that I am not lying
45009002	when I say how great is my sorrow , how endless the pain in my heart
45009003	for my people , my own flesh and blood ! For their sake I could wish that I myself were under God's curse and separated from Christ .
45009004	They are God's people ; he made them his children and revealed his glory to them ; he made his covenants with them and gave them the Law ; they have the true worship ; they have received God's promises ;
45009005	they are descended from the famous Hebrew ancestors ; and Christ , as a human being , belongs to their race . May God , who rules over all , be praised forever ! Amen .
45009006	I am not saying that the promise of God has failed ; for not all the people of Israel are the people of God .
45009007	Nor are all of Abraham's descendants the children of God . God said to Abraham , “ It is through Isaac that you will have the descendants I promised you . ”
45009008	This means that the children born in the usual way are not the children of God ; instead , the children born as a result of God's promise are regarded as the true descendants .
45009009	For God's promise was made in these words : “ At the right time I will come back , and Sarah will have a son . ”
45009010	And this is not all . For Rebecca's two sons had the same father , our ancestor Isaac .
45009013	As the scripture says , “ I loved Jacob , but I hated Esau . ”
45009014	Shall we say , then , that God is unjust ? Not at all .
45009015	For he said to Moses , “ I will have mercy on anyone I wish ; I will take pity on anyone I wish . ”
45009016	So then , everything depends , not on what we humans want or do , but only on God's mercy .
45009017	For the scripture says to the king of Egypt , “ I made you king in order to use you to show my power and to spread my fame over the whole world . ”
45009018	So then , God has mercy on anyone he wishes , and he makes stubborn anyone he wishes .
45009019	But one of you will say to me , “ If this is so , how can God find fault with anyone ? Who can resist God's will ? ”
45009020	But who are you , my friend , to talk back to God ? A clay pot does not ask the man who made it , “ Why did you make me like this ? ”
45009021	After all , the man who makes the pots has the right to use the clay as he wishes , and to make two pots from the same lump of clay , one for special occasions and the other for ordinary use .
45009022	And the same is true of what God has done . He wanted to show his anger and to make his power known . But he was very patient in enduring those who were the objects of his anger , who were doomed to destruction .
45009023	And he also wanted to reveal his abundant glory , which was poured out on us who are the objects of his mercy , those of us whom he has prepared to receive his glory .
45009024	For we are the people he called , not only from among the Jews but also from among the Gentiles .
45009025	This is what he says in the book of Hosea : “ The people who were not mine I will call ‘ My People . ’ The nation that I did not love I will call ‘ My Beloved . ’
45009026	And in the very place where they were told , ‘ You are not my people , ’ there they will be called the children of the living God . ”
45009030	So we say that the Gentiles , who were not trying to put themselves right with God , were put right with him through faith ;
45009031	while God's people , who were seeking a law that would put them right with God , did not find it .
45009032	And why not ? Because they did not depend on faith but on what they did . And so they stumbled over the “ stumbling stone ”
45009033	that the scripture speaks of : “ Look , I place in Zion a stone that will make people stumble , a rock that will make them fall . But whoever believes in him will not be disappointed . ”
45010001	My friends , how I wish with all my heart that my own people might be saved ! How I pray to God for them !
45010002	I can assure you that they are deeply devoted to God ; but their devotion is not based on true knowledge .
45010003	They have not known the way in which God puts people right with himself , and instead , they have tried to set up their own way ; and so they did not submit themselves to God's way of putting people right .
45010004	For Christ has brought the Law to an end , so that everyone who believes is put right with God .
45010005	Moses wrote this about being put right with God by obeying the Law : “ Whoever obeys the commands of the Law will live . ”
45010006	But what the scripture says about being put right with God through faith is this : “ You are not to ask yourself , Who will go up into heaven ? ” ( that is , to bring Christ down ) .
45010007	“ Nor are you to ask , Who will go down into the world below ? ” ( that is , to bring Christ up from death ) .
45010008	What it says is this : “ God's message is near you , on your lips and in your heart ” —that is , the message of faith that we preach .
45010009	If you confess that Jesus is Lord and believe that God raised him from death , you will be saved .
45010010	For it is by our faith that we are put right with God ; it is by our confession that we are saved .
45010011	The scripture says , “ Whoever believes in him will not be disappointed . ”
45010012	This includes everyone , because there is no difference between Jews and Gentiles ; God is the same Lord of all and richly blesses all who call to him .
45010013	As the scripture says , “ Everyone who calls out to the Lord for help will be saved . ”
45010014	But how can they call to him for help if they have not believed ? And how can they believe if they have not heard the message ? And how can they hear if the message is not proclaimed ?
45010015	And how can the message be proclaimed if the messengers are not sent out ? As the scripture says , “ How wonderful is the coming of messengers who bring good news ! ”
45010016	But not all have accepted the Good News . Isaiah himself said , “ Lord , who believed our message ? ”
45010017	So then , faith comes from hearing the message , and the message comes through preaching Christ .
45010018	But I ask : Is it true that they did not hear the message ? Of course they did—for as the scripture says : “ The sound of their voice went out to all the world ; their words reached the ends of the earth . ” “ I will use a so-called nation to make my people jealous ; and by means of a nation of fools I will make my people angry . ” “ I was found by those who were not looking for me ; I appeared to those who were not asking for me . ”
45011001	I ask , then : Did God reject his own people ? Certainly not ! I myself am an Israelite , a descendant of Abraham , a member of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not rejected his people , whom he chose from the beginning . You know what the scripture says in the passage where Elijah pleads with God against Israel :
45011003	“ Lord , they have killed your prophets and torn down your altars ; I am the only one left , and they are trying to kill me . ”
45011004	What answer did God give him ? “ I have kept for myself seven thousand men who have not worshiped the false god Baal . ”
45011005	It is the same way now : there is a small number left of those whom God has chosen because of his grace .
45011006	His choice is based on his grace , not on what they have done . For if God's choice were based on what people do , then his grace would not be real grace .
45011007	What then ? The people of Israel did not find what they were looking for . It was only the small group that God chose who found it ; the rest grew deaf to God's call .
45011008	As the scripture says , “ God made their minds and hearts dull ; to this very day they cannot see or hear . ”
45011009	And David says , “ May they be caught and trapped at their feasts ; may they fall , may they be punished !
45011010	May their eyes be blinded so that they cannot see ; and make them bend under their troubles at all times . ”
45011011	I ask , then : When the Jews stumbled , did they fall to their ruin ? By no means ! Because they sinned , salvation has come to the Gentiles , to make the Jews jealous of them .
45011012	The sin of the Jews brought rich blessings to the world , and their spiritual poverty brought rich blessings to the Gentiles . Then , how much greater the blessings will be when the complete number of Jews is included !
45011013	I am speaking now to you Gentiles : As long as I am an apostle to the Gentiles , I will take pride in my work .
45011014	Perhaps I can make the people of my own race jealous , and so be able to save some of them .
45011015	For when they were rejected , all other people were changed from God's enemies into his friends . What will it be , then , when they are accepted ? It will be life for the dead !
45011016	If the first piece of bread is given to God , then the whole loaf is his also ; and if the roots of a tree are offered to God , the branches are his also .
45011017	Some of the branches of the cultivated olive tree have been broken off , and a branch of a wild olive tree has been joined to it . You Gentiles are like that wild olive tree , and now you share the strong spiritual life of the Jews .
45011018	So then , you must not despise those who were broken off like branches . How can you be proud ? You are just a branch ; you don't support the roots—the roots support you .
45011019	But you will say , “ Yes , but the branches were broken off to make room for me . ”
45011020	That is true . They were broken off because they did not believe , while you remain in place because you do believe . But do not be proud of it ; instead , be afraid .
45011021	God did not spare the Jews , who are like natural branches ; do you think he will spare you ?
45011022	Here we see how kind and how severe God is . He is severe toward those who have fallen , but kind to you—if you continue in his kindness . But if you do not , you too will be broken off .
45011023	And if the Jews abandon their unbelief , they will be put back in the place where they were ; for God is able to do that .
45011024	You Gentiles are like the branch of a wild olive tree that is broken off and then , contrary to nature , is joined to a cultivated olive tree . The Jews are like this cultivated tree ; and it will be much easier for God to join these broken-off branches to their own tree again .
45011025	There is a secret truth , my friends , which I want you to know , for it will keep you from thinking how wise you are . It is that the stubbornness of the people of Israel is not permanent , but will last only until the complete number of Gentiles comes to God .
45011026	And this is how all Israel will be saved . As the scripture says , “ The Savior will come from Zion and remove all wickedness from the descendants of Jacob .
45011027	I will make this covenant with them when I take away their sins . ”
45011033	How great are God's riches ! How deep are his wisdom and knowledge ! Who can explain his decisions ? Who can understand his ways ?
45011034	As the scripture says , “ Who knows the mind of the Lord ? Who is able to give him advice ?
45011035	Who has ever given him anything , so that he had to pay it back ? ”
45012001	So then , my friends , because of God's great mercy to us I appeal to you : Offer yourselves as a living sacrifice to God , dedicated to his service and pleasing to him . This is the true worship that you should offer .
45012002	Do not conform yourselves to the standards of this world , but let God transform you inwardly by a complete change of your mind . Then you will be able to know the will of God—what is good and is pleasing to him and is perfect .
45012003	And because of God's gracious gift to me I say to every one of you : Do not think of yourself more highly than you should . Instead , be modest in your thinking , and judge yourself according to the amount of faith that God has given you .
45012004	We have many parts in the one body , and all these parts have different functions .
45012005	In the same way , though we are many , we are one body in union with Christ , and we are all joined to each other as different parts of one body .
45012006	So we are to use our different gifts in accordance with the grace that God has given us . If our gift is to speak God's message , we should do it according to the faith that we have ;
45012007	if it is to serve , we should serve ; if it is to teach , we should teach ;
45012008	if it is to encourage others , we should do so . Whoever shares with others should do it generously ; whoever has authority should work hard ; whoever shows kindness to others should do it cheerfully .
45012009	Love must be completely sincere . Hate what is evil , hold on to what is good .
45012010	Love one another warmly as Christians , and be eager to show respect for one another .
45012011	Work hard and do not be lazy . Serve the Lord with a heart full of devotion .
45012012	Let your hope keep you joyful , be patient in your troubles , and pray at all times .
45012013	Share your belongings with your needy fellow Christians , and open your homes to strangers .
45012014	Ask God to bless those who persecute you—yes , ask him to bless , not to curse .
45012015	Be happy with those who are happy , weep with those who weep .
45012016	Have the same concern for everyone . Do not be proud , but accept humble duties . Do not think of yourselves as wise .
45012017	If someone has done you wrong , do not repay him with a wrong . Try to do what everyone considers to be good .
45012018	Do everything possible on your part to live in peace with everybody .
45012019	Never take revenge , my friends , but instead let God's anger do it . For the scripture says , “ I will take revenge , I will pay back , says the Lord . ”
45012020	Instead , as the scripture says : “ If your enemies are hungry , feed them ; if they are thirsty , give them a drink ; for by doing this you will make them burn with shame . ”
45012021	Do not let evil defeat you ; instead , conquer evil with good .
45013001	Everyone must obey state authorities , because no authority exists without God's permission , and the existing authorities have been put there by God .
45013002	Whoever opposes the existing authority opposes what God has ordered ; and anyone who does so will bring judgment on himself .
45013003	For rulers are not to be feared by those who do good , but by those who do evil . Would you like to be unafraid of those in authority ? Then do what is good , and they will praise you ,
45013004	because they are God's servants working for your own good . But if you do evil , then be afraid of them , because their power to punish is real . They are God's servants and carry out God's punishment on those who do evil .
45013005	For this reason you must obey the authorities—not just because of God's punishment , but also as a matter of conscience .
45013006	That is also why you pay taxes , because the authorities are working for God when they fulfill their duties .
45013007	Pay , then , what you owe them ; pay them your personal and property taxes , and show respect and honor for them all .
45013008	Be under obligation to no one—the only obligation you have is to love one another . Whoever does this has obeyed the Law .
45013009	The commandments , “ Do not commit adultery ; do not commit murder ; do not steal ; do not desire what belongs to someone else ” —all these , and any others besides , are summed up in the one command , “ Love your neighbor as you love yourself . ”
45013010	If you love others , you will never do them wrong ; to love , then , is to obey the whole Law .
45013011	You must do this , because you know that the time has come for you to wake up from your sleep . For the moment when we will be saved is closer now than it was when we first believed .
45013012	The night is nearly over , day is almost here . Let us stop doing the things that belong to the dark , and let us take up weapons for fighting in the light .
45013013	Let us conduct ourselves properly , as people who live in the light of day—no orgies or drunkenness , no immorality or indecency , no fighting or jealousy .
45013014	But take up the weapons of the Lord Jesus Christ , and stop paying attention to your sinful nature and satisfying its desires .
45014001	Welcome those who are weak in faith , but do not argue with them about their personal opinions .
45014002	Some people's faith allows them to eat anything , but the person who is weak in the faith eats only vegetables .
45014003	The person who will eat anything is not to despise the one who doesn't ; while the one who eats only vegetables is not to pass judgment on the one who will eat anything ; for God has accepted that person .
45014004	Who are you to judge the servants of someone else ? It is their own Master who will decide whether they succeed or fail . And they will succeed , because the Lord is able to make them succeed .
45014005	Some people think that a certain day is more important than other days , while others think that all days are the same . We each should firmly make up our own minds .
45014006	Those who think highly of a certain day do so in honor of the Lord ; those who will eat anything do so in honor of the Lord , because they give thanks to God for the food . Those who refuse to eat certain things do so in honor of the Lord , and they give thanks to God .
45014007	We do not live for ourselves only , and we do not die for ourselves only .
45014008	If we live , it is for the Lord that we live , and if we die , it is for the Lord that we die . So whether we live or die , we belong to the Lord .
45014009	For Christ died and rose to life in order to be the Lord of the living and of the dead .
45014010	You then , who eat only vegetables—why do you pass judgment on others ? And you who eat anything—why do you despise other believers ? All of us will stand before God to be judged by him .
45014011	For the scripture says , “ As surely as I am the living God , says the Lord , everyone will kneel before me , and everyone will confess that I am God . ”
45014013	So then , let us stop judging one another . Instead , you should decide never to do anything that would make others stumble or fall into sin .
45014014	My union with the Lord Jesus makes me certain that no food is of itself ritually unclean ; but if you believe that some food is unclean , then it becomes unclean for you .
45014015	If you hurt others because of something you eat , then you are no longer acting from love . Do not let the food that you eat ruin the person for whom Christ died !
45014016	Do not let what you regard as good get a bad name .
45014017	For God's Kingdom is not a matter of eating and drinking , but of the righteousness , peace , and joy which the Holy Spirit gives .
45014018	And when you serve Christ in this way , you please God and are approved by others .
45014019	So then , we must always aim at those things that bring peace and that help strengthen one another .
45014020	Do not , because of food , destroy what God has done . All foods may be eaten , but it is wrong to eat anything that will cause someone else to fall into sin .
45014021	The right thing to do is to keep from eating meat , drinking wine , or doing anything else that will make other believers fall .
45014022	Keep what you believe about this matter , then , between yourself and God . Happy are those who do not feel guilty when they do something they judge is right !
45014023	But if they have doubts about what they eat , God condemns them when they eat it , because their action is not based on faith . And anything that is not based on faith is sin .
45015001	We who are strong in the faith ought to help the weak to carry their burdens . We should not please ourselves .
45015002	Instead , we should all please other believers for their own good , in order to build them up in the faith .
45015003	For Christ did not please himself . Instead , as the scripture says , “ The insults which are hurled at you have fallen on me . ”
45015004	Everything written in the Scriptures was written to teach us , in order that we might have hope through the patience and encouragement which the Scriptures give us .
45015005	And may God , the source of patience and encouragement , enable you to have the same point of view among yourselves by following the example of Christ Jesus ,
45015006	so that all of you together may praise with one voice the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	Accept one another , then , for the glory of God , as Christ has accepted you .
45015008	For I tell you that Christ's life of service was on behalf of the Jews , to show that God is faithful , to make his promises to their ancestors come true ,
45015009	and to enable even the Gentiles to praise God for his mercy . As the scripture says , “ And so I will praise you among the Gentiles ; I will sing praises to you . ” “ Rejoice , Gentiles , with God's people ! ” “ Praise the Lord , all Gentiles ; praise him , all peoples ! ” “ A descendant of Jesse will appear ; he will come to rule the Gentiles , and they will put their hope in him . ”
45015013	May God , the source of hope , fill you with all joy and peace by means of your faith in him , so that your hope will continue to grow by the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	My friends : I myself feel sure that you are full of goodness , that you have all knowledge , and that you are able to teach one another .
45015015	But in this letter I have been quite bold about certain subjects of which I have reminded you . I have been bold because of the privilege God has given me
45015016	of being a servant of Christ Jesus to work for the Gentiles . I serve like a priest in preaching the Good News from God , in order that the Gentiles may be an offering acceptable to God , dedicated to him by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	In union with Christ Jesus , then , I can be proud of my service for God .
45015018	I will be bold and speak only about what Christ has done through me to lead the Gentiles to obey God . He has done this by means of words and deeds ,
45015019	by the power of miracles and wonders , and by the power of the Spirit of God . And so , in traveling all the way from Jerusalem to Illyricum , I have proclaimed fully the Good News about Christ .
45015020	My ambition has always been to proclaim the Good News in places where Christ has not been heard of , so as not to build on a foundation laid by someone else .
45015021	As the scripture says , “ Those who were not told about him will see , and those who have not heard will understand . ”
45015022	And so I have been prevented many times from coming to you .
45015023	But now that I have finished my work in these regions and since I have been wanting for so many years to come to see you ,
45015024	I hope to do so now . I would like to see you on my way to Spain , and be helped by you to go there , after I have enjoyed visiting you for a while .
45015025	Right now , however , I am going to Jerusalem in the service of God's people there .
45015026	For the churches in Macedonia and Achaia have freely decided to give an offering to help the poor among God's people in Jerusalem .
45015027	That decision was their own ; but , as a matter of fact , they have an obligation to help them . Since the Jews shared their spiritual blessings with the Gentiles , the Gentiles ought to use their material blessings to help the Jews .
45015028	When I have finished this task and have turned over to them all the money that has been raised for them , I shall leave for Spain and visit you on my way there .
45015029	When I come to you , I know that I shall come with a full measure of the blessing of Christ .
45015030	I urge you , friends , by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love that the Spirit gives : join me in praying fervently to God for me .
45015031	Pray that I may be kept safe from the unbelievers in Judea and that my service in Jerusalem may be acceptable to God's people there .
45015032	And so I will come to you full of joy , if it is God's will , and enjoy a refreshing visit with you .
45015033	May God , our source of peace , be with all of you . Amen .
45016001	I recommend to you our sister Phoebe , who serves the church at Cenchreae .
45016002	Receive her in the Lord's name , as God's people should , and give her any help she may need from you ; for she herself has been a good friend to many people and also to me .
45016003	I send greetings to Priscilla and Aquila , my fellow workers in the service of Christ Jesus ;
45016004	they risked their lives for me . I am grateful to them—not only I , but all the Gentile churches as well .
45016005	Greetings also to the church that meets in their house . Greetings to my dear friend Epaenetus , who was the first in the province of Asia to believe in Christ .
45016006	Greetings to Mary , who has worked so hard for you .
45016007	Greetings also to Andronicus and Junia , fellow Jews who were in prison with me ; they are well known among the apostles , and they became Christians before I did .
45016008	My greetings to Ampliatus , my dear friend in the fellowship of the Lord .
45016009	Greetings also to Urbanus , our fellow worker in Christ's service , and to Stachys , my dear friend .
45016010	Greetings to Apelles , whose loyalty to Christ has been proved . Greetings to those who belong to the family of Aristobulus .
45016011	Greetings to Herodion , a fellow Jew , and to the Christians in the family of Narcissus .
45016012	My greetings to Tryphaena and Tryphosa , who work in the Lord's service , and to my dear friend Persis , who has done so much work for the Lord .
45016013	I send greetings to Rufus , that outstanding worker in the Lord's service , and to his mother , who has always treated me like a son .
45016014	My greetings to Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermes , Patrobas , Hermas , and all the other Christians with them .
45016015	Greetings to Philologus and Julia , to Nereus and his sister , to Olympas and to all of God's people who are with them .
45016016	Greet one another with the kiss of peace . All the churches of Christ send you their greetings .
45016017	I urge you , my friends : watch out for those who cause divisions and upset people's faith and go against the teaching which you have received . Keep away from them !
45016018	For those who do such things are not serving Christ our Lord , but their own appetites . By their fine words and flattering speech they deceive innocent people .
45016019	Everyone has heard of your loyalty to the gospel , and for this reason I am happy about you . I want you to be wise about what is good , but innocent in what is evil .
45016020	And God , our source of peace , will soon crush Satan under your feet . The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you .
45016021	Timothy , my fellow worker , sends you his greetings ; and so do Lucius , Jason , and Sosipater , fellow Jews .
45016022	I , Tertius , the writer of this letter , send you Christian greetings .
45016023	My host Gaius , in whose house the church meets , sends you his greetings ; Erastus , the city treasurer , and our brother Quartus send you their greetings .
