45016025	Let us give glory to God ! He is able to make you stand firm in your faith , according to the Good News I preach about Jesus Christ and according to the revelation of the secret truth which was hidden for long ages in the past .
45016026	Now , however , that truth has been brought out into the open through the writings of the prophets ; and by the command of the eternal God it is made known to all nations , so that all may believe and obey .
45016027	To the only God , who alone is all-wise , be glory through Jesus Christ forever ! Amen .
46001001	From Paul , who was called by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus , and from our brother Sosthenes—
46001002	To the church of God which is in Corinth , to all who are called to be God's holy people , who belong to him in union with Christ Jesus , together with all people everywhere who worship our Lord Jesus Christ , their Lord and ours :
46001003	May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace .
46001004	I always give thanks to my God for you because of the grace he has given you through Christ Jesus .
46001005	For in union with Christ you have become rich in all things , including all speech and all knowledge .
46001006	The message about Christ has become so firmly established in you
46001007	that you have not failed to receive a single blessing , as you wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed .
46001008	He will also keep you firm to the end , so that you will be faultless on the Day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001009	God is to be trusted , the God who called you to have fellowship with his Son Jesus Christ , our Lord .
46001010	By the authority of our Lord Jesus Christ I appeal to all of you , my friends , to agree in what you say , so that there will be no divisions among you . Be completely united , with only one thought and one purpose .
46001011	For some people from Chloe's family have told me quite plainly , my friends , that there are quarrels among you .
46001012	Let me put it this way : each one of you says something different . One says , “ I follow Paul ” ; another , “ I follow Apollos ” ; another , “ I follow Peter ” ; and another , “ I follow Christ . ”
46001013	Christ has been divided into groups ! Was it Paul who died on the cross for you ? Were you baptized as Paul's disciples ?
46001014	I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius .
46001015	No one can say , then , that you were baptized as my disciples . (
46001016	Oh yes , I also baptized Stephanas and his family ; but I can't remember whether I baptized anyone else . )
46001017	Christ did not send me to baptize . He sent me to tell the Good News , and to tell it without using the language of human wisdom , in order to make sure that Christ's death on the cross is not robbed of its power .
46001018	For the message about Christ's death on the cross is nonsense to those who are being lost ; but for us who are being saved it is God's power .
46001019	The scripture says , “ I will destroy the wisdom of the wise and set aside the understanding of the scholars . ”
46001021	For God in his wisdom made it impossible for people to know him by means of their own wisdom . Instead , by means of the so-called “ foolish ” message we preach , God decided to save those who believe .
46001022	Jews want miracles for proof , and Greeks look for wisdom .
46001023	As for us , we proclaim the crucified Christ , a message that is offensive to the Jews and nonsense to the Gentiles ;
46001024	but for those whom God has called , both Jews and Gentiles , this message is Christ , who is the power of God and the wisdom of God .
46001025	For what seems to be God's foolishness is wiser than human wisdom , and what seems to be God's weakness is stronger than human strength .
46001026	Now remember what you were , my friends , when God called you . From the human point of view few of you were wise or powerful or of high social standing .
46001027	God purposely chose what the world considers nonsense in order to shame the wise , and he chose what the world considers weak in order to shame the powerful .
46001028	He chose what the world looks down on and despises and thinks is nothing , in order to destroy what the world thinks is important .
46001029	This means that no one can boast in God's presence .
46001030	But God has brought you into union with Christ Jesus , and God has made Christ to be our wisdom . By him we are put right with God ; we become God's holy people and are set free .
46001031	So then , as the scripture says , “ Whoever wants to boast must boast of what the Lord has done . ”
46002001	When I came to you , my friends , to preach God's secret truth , I did not use big words and great learning .
46002002	For while I was with you , I made up my mind to forget everything except Jesus Christ and especially his death on the cross .
46002003	So when I came to you , I was weak and trembled all over with fear ,
46002004	and my teaching and message were not delivered with skillful words of human wisdom , but with convincing proof of the power of God's Spirit .
46002005	Your faith , then , does not rest on human wisdom but on God's power .
46002006	Yet I do proclaim a message of wisdom to those who are spiritually mature . But it is not the wisdom that belongs to this world or to the powers that rule this world—powers that are losing their power .
46002007	The wisdom I proclaim is God's secret wisdom , which is hidden from human beings , but which he had already chosen for our glory even before the world was made .
46002008	None of the rulers of this world knew this wisdom . If they had known it , they would not have crucified the Lord of glory .
46002009	However , as the scripture says , “ What no one ever saw or heard , what no one ever thought could happen , is the very thing God prepared for those who love him . ”
46002013	So then , we do not speak in words taught by human wisdom , but in words taught by the Spirit , as we explain spiritual truths to those who have the Spirit .
46002014	Whoever does not have the Spirit cannot receive the gifts that come from God's Spirit . Such a person really does not understand them , and they seem to be nonsense , because their value can be judged only on a spiritual basis .
46002015	Whoever has the Spirit , however , is able to judge the value of everything , but no one is able to judge him .
46002016	As the scripture says , “ Who knows the mind of the Lord ? Who is able to give him advice ? ”
46003001	As a matter of fact , my friends , I could not talk to you as I talk to people who have the Spirit ; I had to talk to you as though you belonged to this world , as children in the Christian faith .
46003002	I had to feed you milk , not solid food , because you were not ready for it . And even now you are not ready for it ,
46003003	because you still live as the people of this world live . When there is jealousy among you and you quarrel with one another , doesn't this prove that you belong to this world , living by its standards ?
46003004	When one of you says , “ I follow Paul , ” and another , “ I follow Apollos ” —aren't you acting like worldly people ?
46003005	After all , who is Apollos ? And who is Paul ? We are simply God's servants , by whom you were led to believe . Each one of us does the work which the Lord gave him to do :
46003006	I planted the seed , Apollos watered the plant , but it was God who made the plant grow .
46003007	The one who plants and the one who waters really do not matter . It is God who matters , because he makes the plant grow .
46003008	There is no difference between the one who plants and the one who waters ; God will reward each one according to the work each has done .
46003009	For we are partners working together for God , and you are God's field . You are also God's building .
46003010	Using the gift that God gave me , I did the work of an expert builder and laid the foundation , and someone else is building on it . But each of you must be careful how you build .
46003011	For God has already placed Jesus Christ as the one and only foundation , and no other foundation can be laid .
46003012	Some will use gold or silver or precious stones in building on the foundation ; others will use wood or grass or straw .
46003013	And the quality of each person's work will be seen when the Day of Christ exposes it . For on that Day fire will reveal everyone's work ; the fire will test it and show its real quality .
46003014	If what was built on the foundation survives the fire , the builder will receive a reward .
46003015	But if your work is burnt up , then you will lose it ; but you yourself will be saved , as if you had escaped through the fire .
46003016	Surely you know that you are God's temple and that God's Spirit lives in you !
46003017	God will destroy anyone who destroys God's temple . For God's temple is holy , and you yourselves are his temple .
46003018	You should not fool yourself . If any of you think that you are wise by this world's standards , you should become a fool , in order to be really wise .
46003019	For what this world considers to be wisdom is nonsense in God's sight . As the scripture says , “ God traps the wise in their cleverness ” ;
46003020	and another scripture says , “ The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are worthless . ”
46003021	No one , then , should boast about what human beings can do . Actually everything belongs to you :
46003022	Paul , Apollos , and Peter ; this world , life and death , the present and the future—all these are yours ,
46003023	and you belong to Christ , and Christ belongs to God .
46004001	You should think of us as Christ's servants , who have been put in charge of God's secret truths .
46004002	The one thing required of such servants is that they be faithful to their master .
46004003	Now , I am not at all concerned about being judged by you or by any human standard ; I don't even pass judgment on myself .
46004004	My conscience is clear , but that does not prove that I am really innocent . The Lord is the one who passes judgment on me .
46004005	So you should not pass judgment on anyone before the right time comes . Final judgment must wait until the Lord comes ; he will bring to light the dark secrets and expose the hidden purposes of people's minds . And then all will receive from God the praise they deserve .
46004006	For your sake , my friends , I have applied all this to Apollos and me , using the two of us as an example , so that you may learn what the saying means , “ Observe the proper rules . ” None of you should be proud of one person and despise another .
46004007	Who made you superior to others ? Didn't God give you everything you have ? Well , then , how can you boast , as if what you have were not a gift ?
46004008	Do you already have everything you need ? Are you already rich ? Have you become kings , even though we are not ? Well , I wish you really were kings , so that we could be kings together with you .
46004009	For it seems to me that God has given the very last place to us apostles , like people condemned to die in public as a spectacle for the whole world of angels and of human beings .
46004010	For Christ's sake we are fools ; but you are wise in union with Christ ! We are weak , but you are strong ! We are despised , but you are honored !
46004011	To this very moment we go hungry and thirsty ; we are clothed in rags ; we are beaten ; we wander from place to place ;
46004012	we wear ourselves out with hard work . When we are cursed , we bless ; when we are persecuted , we endure ;
46004013	when we are insulted , we answer back with kind words . We are no more than this world's garbage ; we are the scum of the earth to this very moment !
46004014	I write this to you , not because I want to make you feel ashamed , but to instruct you as my own dear children .
46004015	For even if you have ten thousand guardians in your Christian life , you have only one father . For in your life in union with Christ Jesus I have become your father by bringing the Good News to you .
46004016	I beg you , then , to follow my example .
46004017	For this purpose I am sending to you Timothy , who is my own dear and faithful son in the Christian life . He will remind you of the principles which I follow in the new life in union with Christ Jesus and which I teach in all the churches everywhere .
46004018	Some of you have become proud because you have thought that I would not be coming to visit you .
46004019	If the Lord is willing , however , I will come to you soon , and then I will find out for myself the power which these proud people have , and not just what they say .
46004020	For the Kingdom of God is not a matter of words but of power .
46004021	Which do you prefer ? Shall I come to you with a whip , or in a spirit of love and gentleness ?
46005001	Now , it is actually being said that there is sexual immorality among you so terrible that not even the heathen would be guilty of it . I am told that a man is sleeping with his stepmother !
46005002	How , then , can you be proud ? On the contrary , you should be filled with sadness , and the man who has done such a thing should be expelled from your fellowship .
46005005	you are to hand this man over to Satan for his body to be destroyed , so that his spirit may be saved in the Day of the Lord .
46005006	It is not right for you to be proud ! You know the saying , “ A little bit of yeast makes the whole batch of dough rise . ”
46005007	You must remove the old yeast of sin so that you will be entirely pure . Then you will be like a new batch of dough without any yeast , as indeed I know you actually are . For our Passover Festival is ready , now that Christ , our Passover lamb , has been sacrificed .
46005008	Let us celebrate our Passover , then , not with bread having the old yeast of sin and wickedness , but with the bread that has no yeast , the bread of purity and truth .
46005009	In the letter that I wrote you I told you not to associate with immoral people .
46005010	Now I did not mean pagans who are immoral or greedy or are thieves , or who worship idols . To avoid them you would have to get out of the world completely .
46005011	What I meant was that you should not associate with a person who calls himself a believer but is immoral or greedy or worships idols or is a slanderer or a drunkard or a thief . Don't even sit down to eat with such a person .
46006001	If any of you have a dispute with another Christian , how dare you go before heathen judges instead of letting God's people settle the matter ?
46006002	Don't you know that God's people will judge the world ? Well , then , if you are to judge the world , aren't you capable of judging small matters ?
46006003	Do you not know that we shall judge the angels ? How much more , then , the things of this life !
46006004	If such matters come up , are you going to take them to be settled by people who have no standing in the church ?
46006005	Shame on you ! Surely there is at least one wise person in your fellowship who can settle a dispute between fellow Christians .
46006006	Instead , one Christian goes to court against another and lets unbelievers judge the case !
46006007	The very fact that you have legal disputes among yourselves shows that you have failed completely . Would it not be better for you to be wronged ? Would it not be better for you to be robbed ?
46006008	Instead , you yourselves wrong one another and rob one another , even other believers !
46006009	Surely you know that the wicked will not possess God's Kingdom . Do not fool yourselves ; people who are immoral or who worship idols or are adulterers or homosexual perverts
46006010	or who steal or are greedy or are drunkards or who slander others or are thieves—none of these will possess God's Kingdom .
46006011	Some of you were like that . But you have been purified from sin ; you have been dedicated to God ; you have been put right with God by the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God .
46006012	Someone will say , “ I am allowed to do anything . ” Yes ; but not everything is good for you . I could say that I am allowed to do anything , but I am not going to let anything make me its slave .
46006013	Someone else will say , “ Food is for the stomach , and the stomach is for food . ” Yes ; but God will put an end to both . The body is not to be used for sexual immorality , but to serve the Lord ; and the Lord provides for the body .
46006014	God raised the Lord from death , and he will also raise us by his power .
46006015	You know that your bodies are parts of the body of Christ . Shall I take a part of Christ's body and make it part of the body of a prostitute ? Impossible !
46006016	Or perhaps you don't know that the man who joins his body to a prostitute becomes physically one with her ? The scripture says quite plainly , “ The two will become one body . ”
46006017	But he who joins himself to the Lord becomes spiritually one with him .
46006018	Avoid immorality . Any other sin a man commits does not affect his body ; but the man who is guilty of sexual immorality sins against his own body .
46006019	Don't you know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit , who lives in you and who was given to you by God ? You do not belong to yourselves but to God ;
46006020	he bought you for a price . So use your bodies for God's glory .
46007001	Now , to deal with the matters you wrote about . A man does well not to marry .
46007002	But because there is so much immorality , every man should have his own wife , and every woman should have her own husband .
46007003	A man should fulfill his duty as a husband , and a woman should fulfill her duty as a wife , and each should satisfy the other's needs .
46007004	A wife is not the master of her own body , but her husband is ; in the same way a husband is not the master of his own body , but his wife is .
46007005	Do not deny yourselves to each other , unless you first agree to do so for a while in order to spend your time in prayer ; but then resume normal marital relations . In this way you will be kept from giving in to Satan's temptation because of your lack of self-control .
46007006	I tell you this not as an order , but simply as a permission .
46007007	Actually I would prefer that all of you were as I am ; but each one has a special gift from God , one person this gift , another one that gift .
46007008	Now , to the unmarried and to the widows I say that it would be better for you to continue to live alone as I do .
46007009	But if you cannot restrain your desires , go ahead and marry—it is better to marry than to burn with passion .
46007010	For married people I have a command which is not my own but the Lord's : a wife must not leave her husband ;
46007011	but if she does , she must remain single or else be reconciled to her husband ; and a husband must not divorce his wife .
46007012	To the others I say ( I , myself , not the Lord ) : if a Christian man has a wife who is an unbeliever and she agrees to go on living with him , he must not divorce her .
46007013	And if a Christian woman is married to a man who is an unbeliever and he agrees to go on living with her , she must not divorce him .
46007014	For the unbelieving husband is made acceptable to God by being united to his wife , and the unbelieving wife is made acceptable to God by being united to her Christian husband . If this were not so , their children would be like pagan children ; but as it is , they are acceptable to God .
46007015	However , if the one who is not a believer wishes to leave the Christian partner , let it be so . In such cases the Christian partner , whether husband or wife , is free to act . God has called you to live in peace .
46007016	How can you be sure , Christian wife , that you will not save your husband ? Or how can you be sure , Christian husband , that you will not save your wife ?
46007017	Each of you should go on living according to the Lord's gift to you , and as you were when God called you . This is the rule I teach in all the churches .
46007018	If a circumcised man has accepted God's call , he should not try to remove the marks of circumcision ; if an uncircumcised man has accepted God's call , he should not get circumcised .
46007019	For whether or not a man is circumcised means nothing ; what matters is to obey God's commandments .
46007020	Each of you should remain as you were when you accepted God's call .
46007021	Were you a slave when God called you ? Well , never mind ; but if you have a chance to become free , use it .
46007022	For a slave who has been called by the Lord is the Lord's free person ; in the same way a free person who has been called by Christ is his slave .
46007023	God bought you for a price ; so do not become slaves of people .
46007024	My friends , each of you should remain in fellowship with God in the same condition that you were when you were called .
46007025	Now , concerning what you wrote about unmarried people : I do not have a command from the Lord , but I give my opinion as one who by the Lord's mercy is worthy of trust .
46007026	Considering the present distress , I think it is better for a man to stay as he is .
46007027	Do you have a wife ? Then don't try to get rid of her . Are you unmarried ? Then don't look for a wife .
46007028	But if you do marry , you haven't committed a sin ; and if an unmarried woman marries , she hasn't committed a sin . But I would rather spare you the everyday troubles that married people will have .
46007029	What I mean , my friends , is this : there is not much time left , and from now on married people should live as though they were not married ;
46007030	those who weep , as though they were not sad ; those who laugh , as though they were not happy ; those who buy , as though they did not own what they bought ;
46007031	those who deal in material goods , as though they were not fully occupied with them . For this world , as it is now , will not last much longer .
46007032	I would like you to be free from worry . An unmarried man concerns himself with the Lord's work , because he is trying to please the Lord .
46007033	But a married man concerns himself with worldly matters , because he wants to please his wife ;
46007034	and so he is pulled in two directions . An unmarried woman or a virgin concerns herself with the Lord's work , because she wants to be dedicated both in body and spirit ; but a married woman concerns herself with worldly matters , because she wants to please her husband .
46007035	I am saying this because I want to help you . I am not trying to put restrictions on you . Instead , I want you to do what is right and proper , and to give yourselves completely to the Lord's service without any reservation .
46007036	In the case of an engaged couple who have decided not to marry : if the man feels that he is not acting properly toward the young woman and if his passions are too strong and he feels that they ought to marry , then they should get married , as he wants to . There is no sin in this .
46007037	But if a man , without being forced to do so , has firmly made up his mind not to marry , and if he has his will under complete control and has already decided in his own mind what to do—then he does well not to marry the young woman .
46007038	So the man who marries does well , but the one who doesn't marry does even better .
46007039	A married woman is not free as long as her husband lives ; but if her husband dies , then she is free to be married to any man she wishes , but only if he is a Christian .
46007040	She will be happier , however , if she stays as she is . That is my opinion , and I think that I too have God's Spirit .
46008001	Now , concerning what you wrote about food offered to idols . It is true , of course , that “ all of us have knowledge , ” as they say . Such knowledge , however , puffs a person up with pride ; but love builds up .
46008002	Those who think they know something really don't know as they ought to know .
46008003	But the person who loves God is known by him .
46008004	So then , about eating the food offered to idols : we know that an idol stands for something that does not really exist ; we know that there is only the one God .
46008005	Even if there are so-called “ gods , ” whether in heaven or on earth , and even though there are many of these “ gods ” and “ lords , ”
46008006	yet there is for us only one God , the Father , who is the Creator of all things and for whom we live ; and there is only one Lord , Jesus Christ , through whom all things were created and through whom we live .
46008007	But not everyone knows this truth . Some people have been so used to idols that to this day when they eat such food they still think of it as food that belongs to an idol ; their conscience is weak , and they feel they are defiled by the food .
46008008	Food , however , will not improve our relation with God ; we shall not lose anything if we do not eat , nor shall we gain anything if we do eat .
46008009	Be careful , however , not to let your freedom of action make those who are weak in the faith fall into sin .
46008010	Suppose a person whose conscience is weak in this matter sees you , who have so-called “ knowledge , ” eating in the temple of an idol ; will not this encourage him to eat food offered to idols ?
46008011	And so this weak person , your brother for whom Christ died , will perish because of your “ knowledge ” !
46008012	And in this way you will be sinning against Christ by sinning against other Christians and wounding their weak conscience .
46008013	So then , if food makes a believer sin , I will never eat meat again , so as not to make a believer fall into sin .
46009001	Am I not a free man ? Am I not an apostle ? Haven't I seen Jesus our Lord ? And aren't you the result of my work for the Lord ?
46009002	Even if others do not accept me as an apostle , surely you do ! Because of your life in union with the Lord you yourselves are proof of the fact that I am an apostle .
46009003	When people criticize me , this is how I defend myself :
46009004	Don't I have the right to be given food and drink for my work ?
46009005	Don't I have the right to follow the example of the other apostles and the Lord's brothers and Peter , by taking a Christian wife with me on my trips ?
46009006	Or are Barnabas and I the only ones who have to work for our living ?
46009007	What soldiers ever have to pay their own expenses in the army ? What farmers do not eat the grapes from their own vineyard ? What shepherds do not use the milk from their own sheep ?
46009008	I don't have to limit myself to these everyday examples , because the Law says the same thing .
46009009	We read in the Law of Moses , “ Do not muzzle an ox when you are using it to thresh grain . ” Now , is God concerned about oxen ?
46009010	Didn't he really mean us when he said that ? Of course that was written for us . Anyone who plows and anyone who reaps should do their work in the hope of getting a share of the crop .
46009011	We have sown spiritual seed among you . Is it too much if we reap material benefits from you ?
46009012	If others have the right to expect this from you , don't we have an even greater right ? But we haven't made use of this right . Instead , we have endured everything in order not to put any obstacle in the way of the Good News about Christ .
46009013	Surely you know that the men who work in the Temple get their food from the Temple and that those who offer the sacrifices on the altar get a share of the sacrifices .
46009014	In the same way , the Lord has ordered that those who preach the gospel should get their living from it .
46009015	But I haven't made use of any of these rights , nor am I writing this now in order to claim such rights for myself . I would rather die first ! Nobody is going to turn my rightful boast into empty words !
46009016	I have no right to boast just because I preach the gospel . After all , I am under orders to do so . And how terrible it would be for me if I did not preach the gospel !
46009017	If I did my work as a matter of free choice , then I could expect to be paid ; but I do it as a matter of duty , because God has entrusted me with this task .
46009018	What pay do I get , then ? It is the privilege of preaching the Good News without charging for it , without claiming my rights in my work for the gospel .
46009019	I am a free man , nobody's slave ; but I make myself everybody's slave in order to win as many people as possible .
46009020	While working with the Jews , I live like a Jew in order to win them ; and even though I myself am not subject to the Law of Moses , I live as though I were when working with those who are , in order to win them .
46009021	In the same way , when working with Gentiles , I live like a Gentile , outside the Jewish Law , in order to win Gentiles . This does not mean that I don't obey God's law ; I am really under Christ's law .
46009022	Among the weak in faith I become weak like one of them , in order to win them . So I become all things to all people , that I may save some of them by whatever means are possible .
46009023	All this I do for the gospel's sake , in order to share in its blessings .
46009024	Surely you know that many runners take part in a race , but only one of them wins the prize . Run , then , in such a way as to win the prize .
46009025	Every athlete in training submits to strict discipline , in order to be crowned with a wreath that will not last ; but we do it for one that will last forever .
46009026	That is why I run straight for the finish line ; that is why I am like a boxer who does not waste his punches .
46009027	I harden my body with blows and bring it under complete control , to keep myself from being disqualified after having called others to the contest .
46010001	I want you to remember , my friends , what happened to our ancestors who followed Moses . They were all under the protection of the cloud , and all passed safely through the Red Sea .
46010002	In the cloud and in the sea they were all baptized as followers of Moses .
46010003	All ate the same spiritual bread
46010004	and drank the same spiritual drink . They drank from the spiritual rock that went with them ; and that rock was Christ himself .
46010005	But even then God was not pleased with most of them , and so their dead bodies were scattered over the desert .
46010006	Now , all of this is an example for us , to warn us not to desire evil things , as they did ,
46010007	nor to worship idols , as some of them did . As the scripture says , “ The people sat down to a feast which turned into an orgy of drinking and sex . ”
46010008	We must not be guilty of sexual immorality , as some of them were—and in one day twenty-three thousand of them fell dead .
46010009	We must not put the Lord to the test , as some of them did—and they were killed by snakes .
46010010	We must not complain , as some of them did—and they were destroyed by the Angel of Death .
46010011	All these things happened to them as examples for others , and they were written down as a warning for us . For we live at a time when the end is about to come .
46010012	If you think you are standing firm you had better be careful that you do not fall .
46010013	Every test that you have experienced is the kind that normally comes to people . But God keeps his promise , and he will not allow you to be tested beyond your power to remain firm ; at the time you are put to the test , he will give you the strength to endure it , and so provide you with a way out .
46010014	So then , my dear friends , keep away from the worship of idols .
46010015	I speak to you as sensible people ; judge for yourselves what I say .
46010016	The cup we use in the Lord's Supper and for which we give thanks to God : when we drink from it , we are sharing in the blood of Christ . And the bread we break : when we eat it , we are sharing in the body of Christ .
46010017	Because there is the one loaf of bread , all of us , though many , are one body , for we all share the same loaf .
46010018	Consider the people of Israel ; those who eat what is offered in sacrifice share in the altar's service to God .
46010019	Do I imply , then , that an idol or the food offered to it really amounts to anything ?
46010020	No ! What I am saying is that what is sacrificed on pagan altars is offered to demons , not to God . And I do not want you to be partners with demons .
46010021	You cannot drink from the Lord's cup and also from the cup of demons ; you cannot eat at the Lord's table and also at the table of demons .
46010022	Or do we want to make the Lord jealous ? Do we think that we are stronger than he ?
46010023	“ We are allowed to do anything , ” so they say . That is true , but not everything is good . “ We are allowed to do anything ” —but not everything is helpful .
46010024	None of you should be looking out for your own interests , but for the interests of others .
46010025	You are free to eat anything sold in the meat market , without asking any questions because of your conscience .
46010026	For , as the scripture says , “ The earth and everything in it belong to the Lord . ”
46010027	If an unbeliever invites you to a meal and you decide to go , eat what is set before you , without asking any questions because of your conscience .
46010028	But if someone tells you , “ This food was offered to idols , ” then do not eat that food , for the sake of the one who told you and for conscience' sake—
46010029	that is , not your own conscience , but the other person's conscience . “ Well , then , ” someone asks , “ why should my freedom to act be limited by another person's conscience ?
46010030	If I thank God for my food , why should anyone criticize me about food for which I give thanks ? ”
46010031	Well , whatever you do , whether you eat or drink , do it all for God's glory .
46010032	Live in such a way as to cause no trouble either to Jews or Gentiles or to the church of God .
46010033	Just do as I do ; I try to please everyone in all that I do , not thinking of my own good , but of the good of all , so that they might be saved .
46011001	Imitate me , then , just as I imitate Christ .
46011002	I praise you because you always remember me and follow the teachings that I have handed on to you .
46011003	But I want you to understand that Christ is supreme over every man , the husband is supreme over his wife , and God is supreme over Christ .
46011004	So a man who prays or proclaims God's message in public worship with his head covered disgraces Christ .
46011005	And any woman who prays or proclaims God's message in public worship with nothing on her head disgraces her husband ; there is no difference between her and a woman whose head has been shaved .
46011006	If the woman does not cover her head , she might as well cut her hair . And since it is a shameful thing for a woman to shave her head or cut her hair , she should cover her head .
46011007	A man has no need to cover his head , because he reflects the image and glory of God . But woman reflects the glory of man ;
46011008	for man was not created from woman , but woman from man .
46011009	Nor was man created for woman's sake , but woman was created for man's sake .
46011010	On account of the angels , then , a woman should have a covering over her head to show that she is under her husband's authority .
46011011	In our life in the Lord , however , woman is not independent of man , nor is man independent of woman .
46011012	For as woman was made from man , in the same way man is born of woman ; and it is God who brings everything into existence .
46011013	Judge for yourselves whether it is proper for a woman to pray to God in public worship with nothing on her head .
46011014	Why , nature itself teaches you that long hair on a man is a disgrace ,
46011015	but on a woman it is a thing of beauty . Her long hair has been given her to serve as a covering .
46011016	But if anyone wants to argue about it , all I have to say is that neither we nor the churches of God have any other custom in worship .
46011017	In the following instructions , however , I do not praise you , because your meetings for worship actually do more harm than good .
46011018	In the first place , I have been told that there are opposing groups in your meetings ; and this I believe is partly true . (
46011019	No doubt there must be divisions among you so that the ones who are in the right may be clearly seen . )
46011020	When you meet together as a group , it is not the Lord's Supper that you eat .
46011021	For as you eat , you each go ahead with your own meal , so that some are hungry while others get drunk .
46011022	Don't you have your own homes in which to eat and drink ? Or would you rather despise the church of God and put to shame the people who are in need ? What do you expect me to say to you about this ? Shall I praise you ? Of course I don't !
46011023	For I received from the Lord the teaching that I passed on to you : that the Lord Jesus , on the night he was betrayed , took a piece of bread ,
46011024	gave thanks to God , broke it , and said , “ This is my body , which is for you . Do this in memory of me . ”
46011025	In the same way , after the supper he took the cup and said , “ This cup is God's new covenant , sealed with my blood . Whenever you drink it , do so in memory of me . ”
46011026	This means that every time you eat this bread and drink from this cup you proclaim the Lord's death until he comes .
46011027	It follows that if one of you eats the Lord's bread or drinks from his cup in a way that dishonors him , you are guilty of sin against the Lord's body and blood .
46011028	So then , you should each examine yourself first , and then eat the bread and drink from the cup .
46011029	For if you do not recognize the meaning of the Lord's body when you eat the bread and drink from the cup , you bring judgment on yourself as you eat and drink .
46011030	That is why many of you are sick and weak , and several have died .
46011031	If we would examine ourselves first , we would not come under God's judgment .
46011032	But we are judged and punished by the Lord , so that we shall not be condemned together with the world .
46011033	So then , my friends , when you gather together to eat the Lord's Supper , wait for one another .
46011034	And if any of you are hungry , you should eat at home , so that you will not come under God's judgment as you meet together . As for the other matters , I will settle them when I come .
46012001	Now , concerning what you wrote about the gifts from the Holy Spirit . I want you to know the truth about them , my friends .
46012002	You know that while you were still heathen , you were led astray in many ways to the worship of lifeless idols .
46012003	I want you to know that no one who is led by God's Spirit can say “ A curse on Jesus ! ” and no one can confess “ Jesus is Lord , ” without being guided by the Holy Spirit .
46012004	There are different kinds of spiritual gifts , but the same Spirit gives them .
46012005	There are different ways of serving , but the same Lord is served .
46012006	There are different abilities to perform service , but the same God gives ability to all for their particular service .
46012007	The Spirit's presence is shown in some way in each person for the good of all .
46012008	The Spirit gives one person a message full of wisdom , while to another person the same Spirit gives a message full of knowledge .
46012009	One and the same Spirit gives faith to one person , while to another person he gives the power to heal .
46012010	The Spirit gives one person the power to work miracles ; to another , the gift of speaking God's message ; and to yet another , the ability to tell the difference between gifts that come from the Spirit and those that do not . To one person he gives the ability to speak in strange tongues , and to another he gives the ability to explain what is said .
46012011	But it is one and the same Spirit who does all this ; as he wishes , he gives a different gift to each person .
46012012	Christ is like a single body , which has many parts ; it is still one body , even though it is made up of different parts .
46012013	In the same way , all of us , whether Jews or Gentiles , whether slaves or free , have been baptized into the one body by the same Spirit , and we have all been given the one Spirit to drink .
46012014	For the body itself is not made up of only one part , but of many parts .
46012015	If the foot were to say , “ Because I am not a hand , I don't belong to the body , ” that would not keep it from being a part of the body .
46012016	And if the ear were to say , “ Because I am not an eye , I don't belong to the body , ” that would not keep it from being a part of the body .
46012017	If the whole body were just an eye , how could it hear ? And if it were only an ear , how could it smell ?
46012018	As it is , however , God put every different part in the body just as he wanted it to be .
46012019	There would not be a body if it were all only one part !
46012020	As it is , there are many parts but one body .
46012021	So then , the eye cannot say to the hand , “ I don't need you ! ” Nor can the head say to the feet , “ Well , I don't need you ! ”
46012022	On the contrary , we cannot do without the parts of the body that seem to be weaker ;
46012023	and those parts that we think aren't worth very much are the ones which we treat with greater care ; while the parts of the body which don't look very nice are treated with special modesty ,
46012024	which the more beautiful parts do not need . God himself has put the body together in such a way as to give greater honor to those parts that need it .
46012025	And so there is no division in the body , but all its different parts have the same concern for one another .
46012026	If one part of the body suffers , all the other parts suffer with it ; if one part is praised , all the other parts share its happiness .
46012027	All of you are Christ's body , and each one is a part of it .
46012028	In the church God has put all in place : in the first place apostles , in the second place prophets , and in the third place teachers ; then those who perform miracles , followed by those who are given the power to heal or to help others or to direct them or to speak in strange tongues .
46012029	They are not all apostles or prophets or teachers . Not everyone has the power to work miracles
46012030	or to heal diseases or to speak in strange tongues or to explain what is said .
46012031	Set your hearts , then , on the more important gifts . Best of all , however , is the following way .
46013001	I may be able to speak the languages of human beings and even of angels , but if I have no love , my speech is no more than a noisy gong or a clanging bell .
46013002	I may have the gift of inspired preaching ; I may have all knowledge and understand all secrets ; I may have all the faith needed to move mountains—but if I have no love , I am nothing .
46013003	I may give away everything I have , and even give up my body to be burned —but if I have no love , this does me no good .
46013004	Love is patient and kind ; it is not jealous or conceited or proud ;
46013005	love is not ill-mannered or selfish or irritable ; love does not keep a record of wrongs ;
46013006	love is not happy with evil , but is happy with the truth .
46013007	Love never gives up ; and its faith , hope , and patience never fail .
46013008	Love is eternal . There are inspired messages , but they are temporary ; there are gifts of speaking in strange tongues , but they will cease ; there is knowledge , but it will pass .
46013009	For our gifts of knowledge and of inspired messages are only partial ;
46013010	but when what is perfect comes , then what is partial will disappear .
46013011	When I was a child , my speech , feelings , and thinking were all those of a child ; now that I am an adult , I have no more use for childish ways .
46013012	What we see now is like a dim image in a mirror ; then we shall see face-to-face . What I know now is only partial ; then it will be complete—as complete as God's knowledge of me .
46013013	Meanwhile these three remain : faith , hope , and love ; and the greatest of these is love .
46014001	It is love , then , that you should strive for . Set your hearts on spiritual gifts , especially the gift of proclaiming God's message .
46014002	Those who speak in strange tongues do not speak to others but to God , because no one understands them . They are speaking secret truths by the power of the Spirit .
46014003	But those who proclaim God's message speak to people and give them help , encouragement , and comfort .
46014004	Those who speak in strange tongues help only themselves , but those who proclaim God's message help the whole church .
46014005	I would like for all of you to speak in strange tongues ; but I would rather that you had the gift of proclaiming God's message . For the person who proclaims God's message is of greater value than the one who speaks in strange tongues—unless there is someone present who can explain what is said , so that the whole church may be helped .
46014006	So when I come to you , my friends , what use will I be to you if I speak in strange tongues ? Not a bit , unless I bring you some revelation from God or some knowledge or some inspired message or some teaching .
46014007	Take such lifeless musical instruments as the flute or the harp—how will anyone know the tune that is being played unless the notes are sounded distinctly ?
46014008	And if the one who plays the bugle does not sound a clear call , who will prepare for battle ?
46014009	In the same way , how will anyone understand what you are talking about if your message given in strange tongues is not clear ? Your words will vanish in the air !
46014010	There are many different languages in the world , yet none of them is without meaning .
46014011	But if I do not know the language being spoken , those who use it will be foreigners to me and I will be a foreigner to them .
46014012	Since you are eager to have the gifts of the Spirit , you must try above everything else to make greater use of those which help to build up the church .
46014013	The person who speaks in strange tongues , then , must pray for the gift to explain what is said .
46014014	For if I pray in this way , my spirit prays indeed , but my mind has no part in it .
46014015	What should I do , then ? I will pray with my spirit , but I will pray also with my mind ; I will sing with my spirit , but I will sing also with my mind .
46014016	When you give thanks to God in spirit only , how can ordinary people taking part in the meeting say “ Amen ” to your prayer of thanksgiving ? They have no way of knowing what you are saying .
46014017	Even if your prayer of thanks to God is quite good , other people are not helped at all .
46014018	I thank God that I speak in strange tongues much more than any of you .
46014019	But in church worship I would rather speak five words that can be understood , in order to teach others , than speak thousands of words in strange tongues .
46014020	Do not be like children in your thinking , my friends ; be children so far as evil is concerned , but be grown up in your thinking .
46014021	In the Scriptures it is written , “ By means of people speaking strange languages I will speak to my people , says the Lord . I will speak through lips of foreigners , but even then my people will not listen to me . ”
46014023	If , then , the whole church meets together and everyone starts speaking in strange tongues—and if some ordinary people or unbelievers come in , won't they say that you are all crazy ?
46014024	But if everyone is proclaiming God's message when some unbelievers or ordinary people come in , they will be convinced of their sin by what they hear . They will be judged by all they hear ,
46014025	their secret thoughts will be brought into the open , and they will bow down and worship God , confessing , “ Truly God is here among you ! ”
46014026	This is what I mean , my friends . When you meet for worship , one person has a hymn , another a teaching , another a revelation from God , another a message in strange tongues , and still another the explanation of what is said . Everything must be of help to the church .
46014027	If someone is going to speak in strange tongues , two or three at the most should speak , one after the other , and someone else must explain what is being said .
46014028	But if no one is there who can explain , then the one who speaks in strange tongues must be quiet and speak only to himself and to God .
46014029	Two or three who are given God's message should speak , while the others are to judge what they say .
46014030	But if someone sitting in the meeting receives a message from God , the one who is speaking should stop .
46014031	All of you may proclaim God's message , one by one , so that everyone will learn and be encouraged .
46014032	The gift of proclaiming God's message should be under the speaker's control ,
46014033	because God does not want us to be in disorder but in harmony and peace . As in all the churches of God's people ,
46014034	the women should keep quiet in the meetings . They are not allowed to speak ; as the Jewish Law says , they must not be in charge .
46014035	If they want to find out about something , they should ask their husbands at home . It is a disgraceful thing for a woman to speak in a church meeting .
46014036	Or could it be that the word of God came from you ? Or are you the only ones to whom it came ?
46014037	If anyone supposes he is God's messenger or has a spiritual gift , he must realize that what I am writing to you is the Lord's command .
46014038	But if he does not pay attention to this , pay no attention to him .
46014039	So then , my friends , set your heart on proclaiming God's message , but do not forbid the speaking in strange tongues .
46014040	Everything must be done in a proper and orderly way .
46015001	And now I want to remind you , my friends , of the Good News which I preached to you , which you received , and on which your faith stands firm .
46015002	That is the gospel , the message that I preached to you . You are saved by the gospel if you hold firmly to it—unless it was for nothing that you believed .
46015003	I passed on to you what I received , which is of the greatest importance : that Christ died for our sins , as written in the Scriptures ;
46015004	that he was buried and that he was raised to life three days later , as written in the Scriptures ;
46015005	that he appeared to Peter and then to all twelve apostles .
46015006	Then he appeared to more than five hundred of his followers at once , most of whom are still alive , although some have died .
46015007	Then he appeared to James , and afterward to all the apostles .
46015008	Last of all he appeared also to me—even though I am like someone whose birth was abnormal .
46015009	For I am the least of all the apostles—I do not even deserve to be called an apostle , because I persecuted God's church .
46015010	But by God's grace I am what I am , and the grace that he gave me was not without effect . On the contrary , I have worked harder than any of the other apostles , although it was not really my own doing , but God's grace working with me .
46015011	So then , whether it came from me or from them , this is what we all preach , and this is what you believe .
46015012	Now , since our message is that Christ has been raised from death , how can some of you say that the dead will not be raised to life ?
46015013	If that is true , it means that Christ was not raised ;
46015014	and if Christ has not been raised from death , then we have nothing to preach and you have nothing to believe .
46015015	More than that , we are shown to be lying about God , because we said that he raised Christ from death—but if it is true that the dead are not raised to life , then he did not raise Christ .
46015016	For if the dead are not raised , neither has Christ been raised .
46015017	And if Christ has not been raised , then your faith is a delusion and you are still lost in your sins .
46015018	It would also mean that the believers in Christ who have died are lost .
46015019	If our hope in Christ is good for this life only and no more , then we deserve more pity than anyone else in all the world .
46015020	But the truth is that Christ has been raised from death , as the guarantee that those who sleep in death will also be raised .
46015021	For just as death came by means of a man , in the same way the rising from death comes by means of a man .
46015022	For just as all people die because of their union with Adam , in the same way all will be raised to life because of their union with Christ .
46015023	But each one will be raised in proper order : Christ , first of all ; then , at the time of his coming , those who belong to him .
46015024	Then the end will come ; Christ will overcome all spiritual rulers , authorities , and powers , and will hand over the Kingdom to God the Father .
46015025	For Christ must rule until God defeats all enemies and puts them under his feet .
46015026	The last enemy to be defeated will be death .
46015027	For the scripture says , “ God put all things under his feet . ” It is clear , of course , that the words “ all things ” do not include God himself , who puts all things under Christ .
46015028	But when all things have been placed under Christ's rule , then he himself , the Son , will place himself under God , who placed all things under him ; and God will rule completely over all .
46015029	Now , what about those people who are baptized for the dead ? What do they hope to accomplish ? If it is true , as some claim , that the dead are not raised to life , why are those people being baptized for the dead ?
46015030	And as for us—why would we run the risk of danger every hour ?
46015031	My friends , I face death every day ! The pride I have in you , in our life in union with Christ Jesus our Lord , makes me declare this .
46015032	If I have , as it were , fought “ wild beasts ” here in Ephesus simply from human motives , what have I gained ? But if the dead are not raised to life , then , as the saying goes , “ Let us eat and drink , for tomorrow we will die . ”
46015033	Do not be fooled . “ Bad companions ruin good character . ”
46015034	Come back to your right senses and stop your sinful ways . I declare to your shame that some of you do not know God .
46015035	Someone will ask , “ How can the dead be raised to life ? What kind of body will they have ? ”
46015036	You fool ! When you plant a seed in the ground , it does not sprout to life unless it dies .
46015037	And what you plant is a bare seed , perhaps a grain of wheat or some other grain , not the full-bodied plant that will later grow up .
46015038	God provides that seed with the body he wishes ; he gives each seed its own proper body .
46015039	And the flesh of living beings is not all the same kind of flesh ; human beings have one kind of flesh , animals another , birds another , and fish another .
46015040	And there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies ; the beauty that belongs to heavenly bodies is different from the beauty that belongs to earthly bodies .
46015041	The sun has its own beauty , the moon another beauty , and the stars a different beauty ; and even among stars there are different kinds of beauty .
46015042	This is how it will be when the dead are raised to life . When the body is buried , it is mortal ; when raised , it will be immortal .
46015043	When buried , it is ugly and weak ; when raised , it will be beautiful and strong .
46015044	When buried , it is a physical body ; when raised , it will be a spiritual body . There is , of course , a physical body , so there has to be a spiritual body .
46015045	For the scripture says , “ The first man , Adam , was created a living being ” ; but the last Adam is the life-giving Spirit .
46015046	It is not the spiritual that comes first , but the physical , and then the spiritual .
46015047	The first Adam , made of earth , came from the earth ; the second Adam came from heaven .
46015048	Those who belong to the earth are like the one who was made of earth ; those who are of heaven are like the one who came from heaven .
46015049	Just as we wear the likeness of the man made of earth , so we will wear the likeness of the Man from heaven .
46015050	What I mean , friends , is that what is made of flesh and blood cannot share in God's Kingdom , and what is mortal cannot possess immortality .
46015053	For what is mortal must be changed into what is immortal ; what will die must be changed into what cannot die .
46015054	So when this takes place , and the mortal has been changed into the immortal , then the scripture will come true : “ Death is destroyed ; victory is complete ! ”
46015055	“ Where , Death , is your victory ? Where , Death , is your power to hurt ? ”
46015058	So then , my dear friends , stand firm and steady . Keep busy always in your work for the Lord , since you know that nothing you do in the Lord's service is ever useless .
46016001	Now , concerning what you wrote about the money to be raised to help God's people in Judea . You must do what I told the churches in Galatia to do .
46016002	Every Sunday each of you must put aside some money , in proportion to what you have earned , and save it up , so that there will be no need to collect money when I come .
46016003	After I come , I shall give letters of introduction to those you have approved , and send them to take your gift to Jerusalem .
46016004	If it seems worthwhile for me to go , then they can go along with me .
46016005	I shall come to you after I have gone through Macedonia—for I have to go through Macedonia .
46016006	I shall probably spend some time with you , perhaps the whole winter , and then you can help me to continue my trip , wherever it is I shall go next .
46016007	I want to see you more than just briefly in passing ; I hope to spend quite a long time with you , if the Lord allows .
46016008	I will stay here in Ephesus until the day of Pentecost .
46016009	There is a real opportunity here for great and worthwhile work , even though there are many opponents .
46016010	If Timothy comes your way , be sure to make him feel welcome among you , because he is working for the Lord , just as I am .
46016011	No one should look down on him , but you must help him continue his trip in peace , so that he will come back to me ; for I am expecting him back with the believers .
46016012	Now , about brother Apollos . I have often encouraged him to visit you with the other believers , but he is not completely convinced that he should go at this time . When he gets the chance , however , he will go .
46016013	Be alert , stand firm in the faith , be brave , be strong .
46016014	Do all your work in love .
46016015	You know about Stephanas and his family ; they are the first Christian converts in Achaia and have given themselves to the service of God's people . I beg you , my friends ,
46016016	to follow the leadership of such people as these , and of anyone else who works and serves with them .
46016017	I am happy about the coming of Stephanas , Fortunatus , and Achaicus ; they have made up for your absence
46016018	and have cheered me up , just as they cheered you up . Such men as these deserve notice .
46016019	The churches in the province of Asia send you their greetings ; Aquila and Priscilla and the church that meets in their house send warm Christian greetings .
46016020	All the believers here send greetings . Greet one another with the kiss of peace .
46016021	With my own hand I write this : Greetings from Paul .
46016022	Whoever does not love the Lord—a curse on him ! Marana tha —Our Lord , come !
46016023	The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you .
46016024	My love be with you all in Christ Jesus .
47001001	From Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus by God's will , and from our brother Timothy— To the church of God in Corinth , and to all God's people throughout Achaia :
47001002	May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace .
47001003	Let us give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the merciful Father , the God from whom all help comes !
47001004	He helps us in all our troubles , so that we are able to help others who have all kinds of troubles , using the same help that we ourselves have received from God .
47001005	Just as we have a share in Christ's many sufferings , so also through Christ we share in God's great help .
47001006	If we suffer , it is for your help and salvation ; if we are helped , then you too are helped and given the strength to endure with patience the same sufferings that we also endure .
47001007	So our hope in you is never shaken ; we know that just as you share in our sufferings , you also share in the help we receive .
47001008	We want to remind you , friends , of the trouble we had in the province of Asia . The burdens laid upon us were so great and so heavy that we gave up all hope of staying alive .
47001009	We felt that the death sentence had been passed on us . But this happened so that we should rely , not on ourselves , but only on God , who raises the dead .
47001010	From such terrible dangers of death he saved us , and will save us ; and we have placed our hope in him that he will save us again ,
47001011	as you help us by means of your prayers for us . So it will be that the many prayers for us will be answered , and God will bless us ; and many will raise their voices to him in thanksgiving for us .
47001012	We are proud that our conscience assures us that our lives in this world , and especially our relations with you , have been ruled by God-given frankness and sincerity , by the power of God's grace and not by human wisdom .
47001015	I was so sure of all this that I made plans at first to visit you , in order that you might be blessed twice .
47001016	For I planned to visit you on my way to Macedonia and again on my way back , in order to get help from you for my trip to Judea .
47001017	In planning this , did I appear fickle ? When I make my plans , do I make them from selfish motives , ready to say “ Yes , yes ” and “ No , no ” at the same time ?
47001018	As surely as God speaks the truth , my promise to you was not a “ Yes ” and a “ No . ”
47001019	For Jesus Christ , the Son of God , who was preached among you by Silas , Timothy , and myself , is not one who is “ Yes ” and “ No . ” On the contrary , he is God's “ Yes ” ;
47001020	for it is he who is the “ Yes ” to all of God's promises . This is why through Jesus Christ our “ Amen ” is said to the glory of God .
47001021	It is God himself who makes us , together with you , sure of our life in union with Christ ; it is God himself who has set us apart ,
47001022	who has placed his mark of ownership upon us , and who has given us the Holy Spirit in our hearts as the guarantee of all that he has in store for us .
47001023	I call God as my witness—he knows my heart ! It was in order to spare you that I decided not to go to Corinth .
47001024	We are not trying to dictate to you what you must believe ; we know that you stand firm in the faith . Instead , we are working with you for your own happiness .
47002001	So I made up my mind not to come to you again to make you sad .
47002002	For if I were to make you sad , who would be left to cheer me up ? Only the very persons I had made sad .
47002003	That is why I wrote that letter to you—I did not want to come to you and be made sad by the very people who should make me glad . For I am convinced that when I am happy , then all of you are happy too .
47002004	I wrote you with a greatly troubled and distressed heart and with many tears ; my purpose was not to make you sad , but to make you realize how much I love you all .
47002005	Now , if anyone has made somebody sad , he has not done it to me but to all of you—in part , at least . ( I say this because I do not want to be too hard on him . )
47002006	It is enough that this person has been punished in this way by most of you .
47002007	Now , however , you should forgive him and encourage him , in order to keep him from becoming so sad as to give up completely .
47002008	And so I beg you to let him know that you really do love him .
47002009	I wrote you that letter because I wanted to find out how well you had stood the test and whether you are always ready to obey my instructions .
47002010	When you forgive people for what they have done , I forgive them too . For when I forgive—if , indeed , I need to forgive anything—I do it in Christ's presence because of you ,
47002011	in order to keep Satan from getting the upper hand over us ; for we know what his plans are .
47002012	When I arrived in Troas to preach the Good News about Christ , I found that the Lord had opened the way for the work there .
47002013	But I was deeply worried , because I could not find our brother Titus . So I said good-bye to the people there and went on to Macedonia .
47002014	But thanks be to God ! For in union with Christ we are always led by God as prisoners in Christ's victory procession . God uses us to make the knowledge about Christ spread everywhere like a sweet fragrance .
47002015	For we are like a sweet-smelling incense offered by Christ to God , which spreads among those who are being saved and those who are being lost .
47002016	For those who are being lost , it is a deadly stench that kills ; but for those who are being saved , it is a fragrance that brings life . Who , then , is capable for such a task ?
47002017	We are not like so many others , who handle God's message as if it were cheap merchandise ; but because God has sent us , we speak with sincerity in his presence , as servants of Christ .
47003001	Does this sound as if we were again boasting about ourselves ? Could it be that , like some other people , we need letters of recommendation to you or from you ?
47003002	You yourselves are the letter we have , written on our hearts for everyone to know and read .
47003003	It is clear that Christ himself wrote this letter and sent it by us . It is written , not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God , and not on stone tablets but on human hearts .
47003004	We say this because we have confidence in God through Christ .
47003005	There is nothing in us that allows us to claim that we are capable of doing this work . The capacity we have comes from God ;
47003006	it is he who made us capable of serving the new covenant , which consists not of a written law but of the Spirit . The written law brings death , but the Spirit gives life .
47003007	The Law was carved in letters on stone tablets , and God's glory appeared when it was given . Even though the brightness on Moses' face was fading , it was so strong that the people of Israel could not keep their eyes fixed on him . If the Law , which brings death when it is in force , came with such glory ,
47003008	how much greater is the glory that belongs to the activity of the Spirit !
47003009	The system which brings condemnation was glorious ; how much more glorious is the activity which brings salvation !
47003010	We may say that because of the far brighter glory now the glory that was so bright in the past is gone .
47003011	For if there was glory in that which lasted for a while , how much more glory is there in that which lasts forever !
47003012	Because we have this hope , we are very bold .
47003013	We are not like Moses , who had to put a veil over his face so that the people of Israel would not see the brightness fade and disappear .
47003014	Their minds , indeed , were closed ; and to this very day their minds are covered with the same veil as they read the books of the old covenant . The veil is removed only when a person is joined to Christ .
47003015	Even today , whenever they read the Law of Moses , the veil still covers their minds .
47003016	But it can be removed , as the scripture says about Moses : “ His veil was removed when he turned to the Lord . ”
47003017	Now , “ the Lord ” in this passage is the Spirit ; and where the Spirit of the Lord is present , there is freedom .
47003018	All of us , then , reflect the glory of the Lord with uncovered faces ; and that same glory , coming from the Lord , who is the Spirit , transforms us into his likeness in an ever greater degree of glory .
47004001	God in his mercy has given us this work to do , and so we do not become discouraged .
47004002	We put aside all secret and shameful deeds ; we do not act with deceit , nor do we falsify the word of God . In the full light of truth we live in God's sight and try to commend ourselves to everyone's good conscience .
47004003	For if the gospel we preach is hidden , it is hidden only from those who are being lost .
47004004	They do not believe , because their minds have been kept in the dark by the evil god of this world . He keeps them from seeing the light shining on them , the light that comes from the Good News about the glory of Christ , who is the exact likeness of God .
47004005	For it is not ourselves that we preach ; we preach Jesus Christ as Lord , and ourselves as your servants for Jesus' sake .
47004006	The God who said , “ Out of darkness the light shall shine ! ” is the same God who made his light shine in our hearts , to bring us the knowledge of God's glory shining in the face of Christ .
47004007	Yet we who have this spiritual treasure are like common clay pots , in order to show that the supreme power belongs to God , not to us .
47004008	We are often troubled , but not crushed ; sometimes in doubt , but never in despair ;
47004009	there are many enemies , but we are never without a friend ; and though badly hurt at times , we are not destroyed .
47004010	At all times we carry in our mortal bodies the death of Jesus , so that his life also may be seen in our bodies .
47004011	Throughout our lives we are always in danger of death for Jesus' sake , in order that his life may be seen in this mortal body of ours .
47004012	This means that death is at work in us , but life is at work in you .
47004013	The scripture says , “ I spoke because I believed . ” In the same spirit of faith we also speak because we believe .
47004014	We know that God , who raised the Lord Jesus to life , will also raise us up with Jesus and take us , together with you , into his presence .
47004015	All this is for your sake ; and as God's grace reaches more and more people , they will offer to the glory of God more prayers of thanksgiving .
47004016	For this reason we never become discouraged . Even though our physical being is gradually decaying , yet our spiritual being is renewed day after day .
47004017	And this small and temporary trouble we suffer will bring us a tremendous and eternal glory , much greater than the trouble .
47004018	For we fix our attention , not on things that are seen , but on things that are unseen . What can be seen lasts only for a time , but what cannot be seen lasts forever .
47005001	For we know that when this tent we live in—our body here on earth—is torn down , God will have a house in heaven for us to live in , a home he himself has made , which will last forever .
47005002	And now we sigh , so great is our desire that our home which comes from heaven should be put on over us ;
47005003	by being clothed with it we shall not be without a body .
47005004	While we live in this earthly tent , we groan with a feeling of oppression ; it is not that we want to get rid of our earthly body , but that we want to have the heavenly one put on over us , so that what is mortal will be transformed by life .
47005005	God is the one who has prepared us for this change , and he gave us his Spirit as the guarantee of all that he has in store for us .
47005006	So we are always full of courage . We know that as long as we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord's home .
47005007	For our life is a matter of faith , not of sight .
47005008	We are full of courage and would much prefer to leave our home in the body and be at home with the Lord .
47005009	More than anything else , however , we want to please him , whether in our home here or there .
47005010	For all of us must appear before Christ , to be judged by him . We will each receive what we deserve , according to everything we have done , good or bad , in our bodily life .
47005011	We know what it means to fear the Lord , and so we try to persuade others . God knows us completely , and I hope that in your hearts you know me as well .
47005012	We are not trying again to recommend ourselves to you ; rather , we are trying to give you a good reason to be proud of us , so that you will be able to answer those who boast about people's appearance and not about their character .
47005013	Are we really insane ? It is for God's sake . Or are we sane ? Then it is for your sake .
47005014	We are ruled by the love of Christ , now that we recognize that one man died for everyone , which means that they all share in his death .
47005015	He died for all , so that those who live should no longer live for themselves , but only for him who died and was raised to life for their sake .
47005016	No longer , then , do we judge anyone by human standards . Even if at one time we judged Christ according to human standards , we no longer do so .
47005017	Anyone who is joined to Christ is a new being ; the old is gone , the new has come .
47005018	All this is done by God , who through Christ changed us from enemies into his friends and gave us the task of making others his friends also .
47005019	Our message is that God was making all human beings his friends through Christ . God did not keep an account of their sins , and he has given us the message which tells how he makes them his friends .
47005020	Here we are , then , speaking for Christ , as though God himself were making his appeal through us . We plead on Christ's behalf : let God change you from enemies into his friends !
47005021	Christ was without sin , but for our sake God made him share our sin in order that in union with him we might share the righteousness of God .
47006001	In our work together with God , then , we beg you who have received God's grace not to let it be wasted .
47006002	Hear what God says : “ When the time came for me to show you favor , I heard you ; when the day arrived for me to save you , I helped you . ”
47006003	We do not want anyone to find fault with our work , so we try not to put obstacles in anyone's way .
47006004	Instead , in everything we do we show that we are God's servants by patiently enduring troubles , hardships , and difficulties .
47006005	We have been beaten , jailed , and mobbed ; we have been overworked and have gone without sleep or food .
47006006	By our purity , knowledge , patience , and kindness we have shown ourselves to be God's servants—by the Holy Spirit , by our true love ,
47006007	by our message of truth , and by the power of God . We have righteousness as our weapon , both to attack and to defend ourselves .
47006008	We are honored and disgraced ; we are insulted and praised . We are treated as liars , yet we speak the truth ;
47006009	as unknown , yet we are known by all ; as though we were dead , but , as you see , we live on . Although punished , we are not killed ;
47006010	although saddened , we are always glad ; we seem poor , but we make many people rich ; we seem to have nothing , yet we really possess everything .
47006011	Dear friends in Corinth ! We have spoken frankly to you ; we have opened our hearts wide .
47006012	It is not we who have closed our hearts to you ; it is you who have closed your hearts to us .
47006013	I speak now as though you were my children : show us the same feelings that we have for you . Open your hearts wide !
47006014	Do not try to work together as equals with unbelievers , for it cannot be done . How can right and wrong be partners ? How can light and darkness live together ?
47006015	How can Christ and the Devil agree ? What does a believer have in common with an unbeliever ?
47006016	How can God's temple come to terms with pagan idols ? For we are the temple of the living God ! As God himself has said , “ I will make my home with my people and live among them ; I will be their God , and they shall be my people . ” “ You must leave them and separate yourselves from them . Have nothing to do with what is unclean , and I will accept you .
47006018	I will be your father , and you shall be my sons and daughters , says the Lord Almighty . ”
47007001	All these promises are made to us , my dear friends . So then , let us purify ourselves from everything that makes body or soul unclean , and let us be completely holy by living in awe of God .
47007002	Make room for us in your hearts . We have wronged no one ; we have ruined no one , nor tried to take advantage of anyone .
47007003	I do not say this to condemn you ; for , as I have said before , you are so dear to us that we are always together , whether we live or die .
47007004	I am so sure of you ; I take such pride in you ! In all our troubles I am still full of courage ; I am running over with joy .
47007005	Even after we arrived in Macedonia , we did not have any rest . There were troubles everywhere , quarrels with others , fears in our hearts .
47007006	But God , who encourages the downhearted , encouraged us with the coming of Titus .
47007007	It was not only his coming that cheered us , but also his report of how you encouraged him . He told us how much you want to see me , how sorry you are , how ready you are to defend me ; and so I am even happier now .
47007008	For even if that letter of mine made you sad , I am not sorry I wrote it . I could have been sorry when I saw that it made you sad for a while .
47007009	But now I am happy—not because I made you sad , but because your sadness made you change your ways . That sadness was used by God , and so we caused you no harm .
47007010	For the sadness that is used by God brings a change of heart that leads to salvation—and there is no regret in that ! But sadness that is merely human causes death .
47007011	See what God did with this sadness of yours : how earnest it has made you , how eager to prove your innocence ! Such indignation , such alarm , such feelings , such devotion , such readiness to punish wrongdoing ! You have shown yourselves to be without fault in the whole matter .
47007012	So , even though I wrote that letter , it was not because of the one who did wrong or the one who was wronged . Instead , I wrote it to make plain to you , in God's sight , how deep your devotion to us really is .
47007013	That is why we were encouraged . Not only were we encouraged ; how happy Titus made us with his happiness over the way in which all of you helped to cheer him up !
47007014	I did boast of you to him , and you have not disappointed me . We have always spoken the truth to you , and in the same way the boast we made to Titus has proved true .
47007015	And so his love for you grows stronger , as he remembers how all of you were ready to obey his instructions , how you welcomed him with fear and trembling .
47007016	How happy I am that I can depend on you completely !
47008001	Our friends , we want you to know what God's grace has accomplished in the churches in Macedonia .
47008002	They have been severely tested by the troubles they went through ; but their joy was so great that they were extremely generous in their giving , even though they are very poor .
